F88bSIBClWhyGsfuJNpl_g.text: There are three things on the menu: lobster, lobster roll, and the burger. They don't even bother handing you a menu. Each is 20 pounds. Service is good. We first went to the other Burger & Lobster location, where the wait was over an hour. Tthe host was kind enough to call the Soho location and inquire if they had space. Lucky for us, they did, and there was no wait. It was a bit troublesome to trek across the city, but considering how hungry we were, it was worth it. Service continued to be good, with our waiter being a nice guy, funny, and prompt. He did mix up one of our orders though, but I won't dock points since he said he was new. I ordered the grilled lobster. Others at my table got steamed lobster, but safe to say, no one thought about getting the burger. The lobster was a healthy 1.5 pounds with lots of roe and tomale. Each also came with a tasty salad (arugula, cheese, and balsamic) and chips/fries. I don't think any of us finished the chips! It was just a ton of food. Very very tasty food. I admit I was skeptical of the price tag and value of the meal, but everything was so tasty and the place so comfortable, that we were more than happy to leave a good tip at the end!

1ePI0zvtqf5mjFfHwXVs1A.text: This was an excellent place to visit.  Delicious food, great atmosphere and tasty desserts.  My fiends and families loved it! I recommend this for everyone to experience...place it on the must go list

TunB-kM2fG7WGZ8gpvcMAw.text: This is one of the best places I have eaten in london! Although it is a bit pricey, the 20pounds is worth it because they give you a whole lobster! The lobster seriously gets you full, but they also include fries and a salad! They also serve a big burger as their 2nd option and a lobster roll as a 3rd option for those of you who don't like to crack the lobster! Definitely saving my money to come here again! Make sure to bring your friends! It's a must go to place if you're costing London!

WL_hOc4fcj6-8eP1cQu8RQ.text: I have visited Burger & Lobster twice now, and both times the service has been impeccable. The first time I visited, my friend and I were gently asked if we would move tables because they had a large party arriving. This was no problem for us as we had finished eating, but they insisted on bringing us two desserts on the house to say thank you.The food is delicious, and it arrives very quickly. I particularly love the lobster roll - plenty of lobster meat in a toasted brioche bun served with melted better - yum!

qLIvo6uuE1mv0HhSrphy_w.text: This place was first recommended by me by a local London friend, and we decided to finally try it. Well we were amazed! There are only three things on the menu: a burger, a lobster roll, and a whole lobster. My friend recommended that we get only the lobster roll and lobster, which is what we did exactly. We asked for the garlic butter with the whole lobster along with the lobster roll. Everything tasted divine, and the cost was only 20 pounds per dish, definitely worth the price! I would recommend this place and definitely am planning to come back again with other friends who have not yet tried this local favorite yet!

tFMrV1Dgcq7Jcr2kJ7WSIw.text: Absolutely love this place. There can be long queues, especially at popular dinner and lunch times, but totally worth it. I've tried both the burger and lobster roll, and have never been disappointed. The lobster roll is packed with lobster meat and served on a delicious buttered brioche roll (yes, that bun alone might be a heart attack, but lipsmacking good i say!). The burger almost seems expensive at 20 pounds compared to the lobster and lobster roll, which are all offered at the same price, but definitely one of the great burgers of London.This restaurant has been expanding around London, but I've only been to the Mayfair and Soho locations which are very different in terms of ambience (same amazing level of food). The Mayfair location is smaller and feels more intimate while the Soho location has more tables and feels more modern. These locations have different perks but you really can't go wrong when burger or lobster is involved!

TltFfCzYT4-E_9jyuhHrxA.text: Very efficient place, simple menu choice and £20 for lobster is great value, trunks are slightly on the expensive side (330 ml cider £5), our waiter was friends and we were served very quickly hand food was ready in a speedy manner as well. For Saturday you better book a table in advance otherwise you will que up to 1 hr.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. 20 lobster :)

x1d2DkW71dQe_6Ruc51MvA.text: Update: It really did take several tweets, emails and calls but they finally got back to me. They were apologetic, and admitted 2 things:- That they were at fault that day at the Soho branch- HQ was also at fault for not getting back to me and it wasn't intentional, and that it fell through the cracks somehow in their communicationThey said it was a sign that they need some training on their side and invited me back to show that they can provide quality food (something I didn't doubt) with great customer service. This was the type of response I was hoping for, though it sucked that it took this long for someone to get back to me.  Maybe I'll finally get to post a proper review on their food + service!  There are tons of positive reviews on their food, so at this point, I'm not doubting the food quality... they just need to work on their customer service.

abotvX3OX1FxAN_sOTNl7Q.text: Don't be mistaken here, it's Burger OR Lobster. But what you really should go for is the Lobster Roll (third and final option on the menu)! Who goes for the burger here anyway, when you have another 1000 places in London that do proper burgers?The roll comes as a toasted garlic-butter sandwich, stuffed with pieces of lobster meat. Along come a little salad, a portion of fries and extra sauce.  It's the combo of the fresh lobster, the toasted-to-perfection bread and that sauce that really makes this a dish worth paying £20 for. I had a whisky-based cocktail (can't remember the name and can't find the menu on their website) which was about £9 and really good as well.Make sure to go there first, put your name down (they call you when your table is ready) and go for a drink somewhere else until it's your turn. Prepare yourself however for more of a fast food service. You get seated, pick your drink, pick your food (there's no food menu) and 5 min later you get served. It's not really a place to hangout or have a relaxing dinner which is a bit of a shame for a £20 meal.

C2HYiAF1_JV9C6cQnKXLSA.text: Ok the downside is the wait... Goodness, the wait if you're not on your own is ridiculous - 2 hours if you come during peak time (thursday to saturday evenings). If you're on your own, you can sit at the bar and don't have to wait at all.On another note - their simple and straightforward menu hits the spot. I don't like spending forever deciding which derivative of the same food I'd want to have. So the choice is lobster, burger and lobster roll each for £20. I would rate them: lobster - #1, lobster roll - #2 and burger - #3. Basically I've had better burgers. I love simple clarified butter which doesn't overpower the flavour of the lobster meat. And oh my...their berry cheesecake mousse is a cloud of happiness (don't be surprised that it's served in a porridge takeaway pot! - it's cool, alright?).I went there with my friends for breakfasts, lunches, dinners. I went there on my own - it's just so very comfortable in there for whatever reason! And I also love the bar seats in this branch, I often ask for the seat there even if I'm not on my own :)The service is quick too.

dJPXCeLwYBb2mdBFDN_zoA.text: Basic but tasty you choose from burger, lobster or lobster roll. The lobster tends to be way over cooked. The roll is usually pretty good. The burger is a rip off at £20. Good if you haven't tried lobster before

ss4aKzwfO-ib6kasylEMuw.text: i'm not the biggest fan of roast dinners so my favourite alternative is to head to burger and lobster for an late sunday afternoon lunch. everyone knows the drill by now about burger and lobster...you get the choice of a burger, lobster or lobster roll served with salad and fries for just £20. its a simple concept to follow plus they even paint the instructions on the wall for anyone struggling to understand....whenever i've been, the wait for a table is ALWAYS at least about 40 minutes but instead of giving up and going somewhere else...be patient! you can pop your name on the waiting list and they'll give you  a call when your tables ready so you're free to go for a wander or drink elsewhere. My advice - prop yourself up at the bar and have a drink - the cocktails are seriously good!Once you've made the arduous decision as to whether you're going to go surf or turf, sit back and get ready for the beautiful beast to make it's way to your table. I always go whole lobster, grilled with lemon butter, however I have it on good authority that the burger is amazing too though....and i really do intend to try it every time I go, but £20 for a whole lobster? There's no arguing with that.There's now serveral B&L locations across London including the 5th Floor at Harvey Nics.

6NXJ63sFDPuhScl_wA5lZw.text: I shouldn't have introduced my family to this place. My mother has her tai-tai parties here way too much. They have like at least 2 parties a month here. I feel like I created a lobster chowing monster. It's bigger branch, it serves lobster for £20. You can supersize too. (not like mcdonalds, okay a posh mcdonalds). They have yummy cocktails, try the one with black pepper, and also try the one with grapefruit fizz sherbert. Both are amazing. So live it up, throw down the cutlery, bib on, get cracking and chow down, whilst drinking delicious cocktails. I do not appreciate the chinese couple next to me who managed to spill ketchup over my free weaved great quality bag.

2EPZucAOcm2JW1klne-7eA.text: As the name suggests, this place is all about burger & lobster. They only have 3 courses on offer, all priced at £20:- A whole lobster (steamed or grilled)- A massive beef burger with bacon and cheese- Lobster roll: lobster meat mixed with Japanese mayo packed in a brios bunOur party tried out all the courses and we were not dissapointed. I am not a great fan of seafood so I went for the burger. It was excellent but the £20 price tag was a bit high in my opinion. The lobster on the other hand was apparently amazing!The atmosphere and decor of the place is nice and even it's big and busy it was not too loud. They have a nice selection of beers and wine which for London standards are even decently priced.It's a super trendy at the moment so get there early or prepare to queue. We had to wait for only about 15min but when we left the queue was out the door!If the burger would have been slightly cheaper this would have been a 5* review!

W8CwUc5bOlUntreV4VLSTA.text: Burger and Lobster is undeniably the most talked about restaurant amongst our friends and colleagues and so we were curious to find out what this hype is all about.But the funny thing is when we were hanging out in Soho, Mayfair on a Wednesday afternoon. we consequently walked pass this restaurant, It almost felt like we were destined to dine there.Although we didn't make any reservations we still managed to grab a good seat beside an enormous lobster tank, making me feel like I was in the sea-life aquarium again. Happy times.The restaurant was absolutely buzzing with large groups of people and the interior had an old rustic American dinner appeal to it with a cocktail bar.I absolutely loved the fact that there was no menu and only 3 options were available. We decided to order a grilled lobster over the choice of stemmed lobster or a burger.Finally when the lobster made it to our table, it looked regal sitting on the silver platter, and at first glance we just knew it was going to be succulent and bursting with flavours. The whole meal looked bountiful with complementary skinny fries, garlic butter dips, and a crunchy salad covered in sprinkles of goat cheese.Read more here and help us growfacebook.com/pages/Food-…

dzOEF855S3MmwxHCLPub2g.text: The grilled lobster is good but not perfect! and the bread for the lobster roll is nice~ it delicious but not worthy that long queue~

Tm-oMiZ3FsHvmzoH7Gt2HQ.text: Food was insane! We had the combo and was enough for 2 person. Next time i ll try steak&lobster. Service was very friendly and attentively.

Z4P4ZMiAaBwKVl4ZbLKe7w.text: One cold February evening, in London Town,I phoned my Good Friend, who said he was down,To dine on a lovely dish,Of impeccably prepared shellfish. Burger, lobster and lobster (roll)...are your choices.If you're big on variety, this may leave you listless. I went for the lobster, as did Good Friend. The best choice in terms of a value to money spend. (Plus, to go for anything else would be obscene. In clear violation of Yee Gan O.'s wise, guiding Thrift Gene). Casual glance around the place, it was packed to the max. Like the Beastie Boys' Intergalact, sardines in a can, stacked!We waited at the bar, had to fight for a seat. Eyes rolling, heads lolling, Passive aggressive looks flowin', elbows throwin', Whatever a girl's gotta do for some meat! Well, if the logistics and ambiance are boring you, dude. Then, onwards! Onwards, and on to the food. Sigh of relief, finally seated. Our wait of an hour, completed. Service was spotless, waiter knowledgeable and nice. When asked questions, so silly 'tude or Larry David Krazee Eyez. Brought cutlery, more drinks and two bibs. You know, the kind you get when you eat ribs. Out came the plates and they were large. Not sure if I can finish this, better put Charles in Charge? Salad, a pot of chips/fries, a huge lobster, butter sauce.With the obligatory cutlery, then left to your own devices, you're the boss. Lob offered grilled or steamed, I went for the former with no regrets.  It was perfect, I dined with no upsets. Easily slid out of it's shell. Dipped it in butter, the salad and chips were good as well. The lobster roll looked huge, filled to the brim,With mayo-ey goodness, enclosed by a lovely brioche bun, prim. Looked far and wide for a glimpse of the burger, tender, brown ground.Like looking for lobster at In N' Out, nowhere to be found. And for 20 quid, I see why. Is the beef Kobe quality, if the price is so sky high? Not sure, because I did not try it. But perhaps someone would say that their money was well spent. Was surprised at the grand size of the venue,Large beer and wine list, more extensive than the menu. But overall, that was okay. 'Cause it's not like you go for the drinks anyway. Enjoyed Burger & Lobster, have to say. And I definitely would go out of my way. To return to this place, although it's pricey.The bathrooms were chic and clean, mirrors pristine, service wasn't too dicey. But if you're a vegetarian, Fair Yelper. A visit is as useless as an empty fridge and a box of Hamburger Helper.

yFG0GQAHXK7IQ9Ze6I8fCA.text: Only two courses, really? Nothing special about the place.

1LXEjzNkrQynqCIwXlR2uQ.text: I went for my friend's dinner and was excited to try to the lobster. But the food was utterly catastrophic and service was even worse. What restaurant doesn't even have a menu? I paid over £20 for food that I would not feed to my dog. Extremely disappointing. All the best

RqYhLgtKk2c1qWmdJAQk5w.text: Following all the hype with Burger & Lobster, my husband and I finally went to try it out. There are only three choices on the menu, which makes it easy to know what you want and as a result service is prompt, friendly & relaxed. The atmosphere is buzzing and the staff are equally enthusiastic.It is not a posh set up, but I do recommend the place...their white chocolate cheesecake twist is a must have!!!

-iR36vz_tpVmNlO_c1GLZg.text: Amazing we had the combo burger and lobster !! I highly recommend this place!

nq0lm2AbTFf-KsXPMxMkNw.text: Nice place! And amazing service/food!I recommend to everybody to try this at least once! If you are in two or three the wait shouldn't be long..

IZ0GVzstNeeRl5NFpyNYUQ.text: Okay- lesson learned. Always go for lobster or lobster roll! The burger is tasty too but certainly not extraordinary and for the price, very expensive even for London.The lobster roll is amazing. I would recommend going during less common hours as it can get crowded with tourist groups during normal lunch/dinner times.

AN2HZ5dMdp-2EJod1eJzwA.text: I think just 3 stars because quite expensive. Lobster is quite small and dry ..... and i really like sauce because so creamyyy and smell very nice

-PnP9oX9C2--JL2DZ404AA.text: I am not actually a big fan of lobster so this review is a bit biased!I still wanted to go there as the idea was cool and serving only a few options on the menu sounded promisingWe went mid week at about 8 after some drinks and there was a pretty big queue! Wait was long but we stuck with it as that's were we had decided to goEventually got inside, then eventually got seated. By this point wasn't really that hungry Ordered cocktails which were nice and then food. 2 friends I went with ordered the lobster and I went with the lobster rollThey both said it was ok, nothing wrong with it but weren't bowled over especially as lobster is there thingMy brioche bun was gooood and warm but the lobster inside was cold as it was a premixed chopped up lobster. I didn't really like that it was cold and I asked them to heat it up knowing that it could change the quality but they flat out refused in a rather rude way! There wasn't much else to the meal and I ended up paying £30 for a drink and a sandwich so wasn't very impressed by the cost eitherI wouldn't come back again - the food wasn't awful I just don't think it is worth it

BA-bJGg8gavXUD0bH_Jhmg.text: We went for our vday lunch rather unplanned. We showed up around 5mins before noon, and there was already a line! We both got lobster rolls. I knew what to expect as I had been to the one near Green Park before. Having said that, I felt that the quality was slightly less than how I remembered it. It was still solid good. Everything was spot on, and I loved all the lobster packed in the tasty brioche roll as I always have!A pleasant surprise were the cocktails. I ordered the Oblisque (name?), and I absolutely loved it.Service was amazing as well. Prompt and also very kind. Finally, the venue was a lot more spacious and stylish than the one near Green Park. Definitely worth a try if you haven't tried it yet!

3mjrxa4EMV7B_wTCveZRbQ.text: Before coming to London this restaurant had been put on our list as " must visits " due to great reviews from various sites ,and when we finally did get there it proved well worthy of such . The first night we were in London we thought we will go then , so we wandered along until getting to it we were told sorry full up and closing not so far away anyway. So we decided   to go elsewhere and come back at an earlier time the next day.  So coming back earlier proved worthwhile....though around lunchtime it was packed out and we had to wait a little while to get a table . But that's okay. And we grabbed a drink from the bar while waiting. Finally seated our choices were easily made. The Lobster Roll for myself and the Whole Lobster for my better half.  The service was good, with a smile and the orders came out pretty quickly despite the place being packed out. And about the food....Though i have not eating lobster that much the lobster roll was top notch and would i reckon satisfy even those who detest lobster.  As for the whole lobster...well the same could be said from the comments i got. All the mains by the way are served with fries and salad. To sum it all up excellent service, food, and though a little noisy due to being a busy restaurant the ambience / atmosphere inside is still good. Nice place to chow down on some beautiful lobster and smack bang in the centre of London too!! Highly recommend!!Just expect a little bit of a wait especially at night. Enjoy!!!

rF0uBK55CBrjCEKs4wSMvA.text: My friend in London is always talking about Burger and Lobster, so when I was visiting last weekend I jumped at the chance to go. There are 6 B&L restaurants to choose from in London - we happened to stumble across the Soho branch and I am very glad I did. Arriving there at 5pm, there was a small queue of people waiting for tables - and after being told there would be a 30 - 40 minute wait for a table I decided that I would wait it out. 30 mins later we were shown to our table and a waitress approached. There is no physical menu put in front of you, but the waitress explains how it works. The concept is brilliant - you pay £20 and for that you get either a Burger or a Lobster. Simple. - The burgers are a 10oz beef burger served either plain from the grill or with bacon and / or cheese. - The lobster is a 1.5lb whole lobster served either steamed or steamed and finished off on the grill with lemon and garlic butter. - They also do a lobster roll - cold lobster meat dressed in a Japanese mayo serviced in a warm toasted brioche bun. All dishes are served with French fries and a side salad. After looking around the restaurant it was clear which was the most popular choice. We both opted for Lobster, to which the waitress said 'excellent choice' - she was right. The dish was fantastic - the lobster was perfectly cooked, halved, in the shell and the fries were fab, especially dipped in the garlic butter sauce provided for the lobster. I fastened my bib, yes BIB, and got cracking on those lobster claws. They have other lobster options available or 'Jumbo' options on a blackboard ranging up to 90lb lobster for £172!!The restaurant is pretty big but the tables are close together - which makes the experience all the more fun when you look around and everyone else is wearing a bib too! You can't help but laugh. When we left (around 6.45pm) the queue was out of the door AND down the street. The wait was over an hour and half but the people waiting didn't seem to mind. They must have been before and know how good it is. This restaurant in Soho only takes reservations for groups between 6 - 10 people - so for everyone else you just have to wait. The fact I had to wait 30 minutes is the only reason i haven't given B&L 5 stars.. but it was London on a Sunday evening so i can't be too critical. I'll definitely be going to B&L again - and with rumors of a Manchester branch opening on King St soon it will be going to the top of my favourites list!
