PnRSf6umbWeQeCv2bPhMWg.text: The Goodman Brothers have done it again.   Great lobster, great fries, salad, cool Soho atmosphere, all for £20...incredible!  Minus a star because of its no-bookings rules...it is FAR too popular for people to not be able to make reservations.  Waiting to queue for 2 hours or more with a group is not unheard of (ugh).  Plan accordingly. Major tip: if it's a small party, ask to be seated at the bar...we got the full menu treatment and didn't have to wait at all.  But WHENEVER you get to a table/seat, know that it will be one of the most delicious budget-friendly experiences you can have in Soho!

MX67B-jH0HS3kzdv7j1ScA.text: If you live in London you're bound to have heard of Burger & Lobster, if you haven't, the biggest hint you'll get is the name and the best surprise is yet to come..Can I start by talking about the butter? Because quite honestly if there was ever anything I'd justify dipping into pure melted butter, it's got to be lobster... It just demands it.Lemon and herb clarified butter smothering each meaty yet delicate morsel, yes indulgence is the key at Burger & Lobster and if you can't hack that then just don't bother.My friend, Lauren and I headed there for our girls' night, which it so happened turned into somewhat of a celebration, as she has been announced as first author on a medical journal! So my published friend and I headed for the Dean Street branch of this little, well-known place.The occasion demanded that we enjoy champagne with such glutinous glory - that, as I understand it, is very much the purpose of eating lobster. And of course such outlandishly expensive meat insists the side orders allow you to double said indulgence, no skimping here... So we complied with a *chink* of our glasses and a "Chin! Chin!"The thing is, that surprise we're waiting on, is that this particular lobster, of quite substantial size set me back a whole, ooh, £20.  Not hardly the bank breaking endeavour one expected from the evening of lavish crustacean, smothered in glorious buttery bliss. Let's not forget, with a side of proper potato fries (I stress proper.. not frozen to fried rubbish) and a respectable side salad, dressed with balsamic reduction and parmesan shavings to ensure its adequacy amongst the plate of 'pucka'... So you see, of course we went for the champagne to sip it all down.As I found myself in a suitably sociable surrounding whilst eating Lobster, (there was no one offering to pull my chair out and the restaurant is very much of an American diner vibe, buzzy and loud) I couldn't help but breach etiquette and offer Lauren a round of 'a-claws' for her achievements.....and then we proceeded to fling our lobster out towards each other, because if there's one thing we're definitely not, it's shellfish.So what do you need to know on your first visit?You need to know that the question is not, 'to bun or not to bun?' The question is a simple one for a first timer, 'steamed or grilled?'Oh yes, the first time - I wanted the shell, the bib, the picky fork thing and the passionate pinch of the lobster as I tried to manoeuvre the meat from inside its shell... Wish (challenge) granted! And an option I'd highly recommend, the following steps will provide an optimum dining experience...Choose the whole lobster (pay more for a larger one if you fancy) - steamed or grilled, treat it kindly and give it a butter bath and champagne slide all the way to bed(that's your belly).We both had the steamed whole lobster and it was moist and delicious!Now what's also important as an experienced first timer is that I wouldn't advise you bring a date here until a well-trained cracking and pulling technique has been ascertained, because personally,  I chose to eat every last bit of it, that pretty pink crustacean. Oh no! It did not defeat me, but the wrestle to the finish line may not have made the most attractive date. Lauren could probably vouch for me... .. I could definitely vouch for her!C.x

_HbjIfVGFxrNGlL0Yrq4Kg.text: Literally this place is a joke. I honestly feel like everyone that loves this place has never experienced truly fresh lobster. As an American that grew up only eating fresh seafood, this just REALLY doesn't cut it. Frozen lobster completely lacking in flavour? No thanks....I would pay twice the price for the same meal made with fresh lobster. This is not what lobster is meant to taste like...not to mention I had a stomachache afterwards...And the burger is nothing special - so not worth £20. But 2 stars because the fries are good - the best thing in this place actually. Just get a big plate of fries, a small mediocre salad and a glass of red wine if you have the unfortunate luck of ending up here for lunch or dinner. But do not, I repeat, do not get the lobster.

PMXXNo5UihOjpsM_im-7LQ.text: 26 quid for the regular lobster. A bit small since I'm use to Maine lobsters.  Everything was fresh and delicious though.  Good side salad crisp american fries not chips/ steak fries.  I've learned my lesson about lobster in England. Not quite large enough to fill my craving.

F6F7v02g3WsQUWu-5i_pRA.text: I was visiting from the US and received a recommendation to check this place out from one of my Brit friends. On a Thursday night around 8 pm, the wait was about 30 minutes. Not bad if say. I enjoyed how they encouraged us to drink while waiting by sending over a server to bring drinks. I must say that the drinks were my favorite part of my visit. If you are a fan of Hendricks gin, try the Camomile Fizz. Delish!As we entered the dining area, it became very LOUD! When we were sat, I was a bit underwhelmed. Instead of a traditional menu, the server explained their 3-4 options. Given how loud it was, this would have been fine for one with a keen ear to the British accent however my American trained ear was a bit slow to pick up what the options were. Ultimately, you have a choice between a (1) small steamed lobster, (2) a lobster roll or (3) a hamburger. Each option comes with fries and a small side salad that is covered in balsamic dressing and parmesan cheese. Each option is also the same price of 20 pounds. Apparently our server had an untrained ear to American accents because our order came out wrong. We ordered two lobster rolls and ended up with one lobster roll and one steamed lobster. The food was good; the drinks were better. I'd definitely return for the cocktails but I'd likely eat elsewhere as the lobster was not dressed to impress.

OiLL8WKorYsAqNXlztrxKA.text: A place called Burger & Lobster obviously doesn't have a menu.... do you want a freakin burger or a lobster? Here ya go, they're both good.Love this concept and loved my server - he sat with us, gave us drink recommendations, and all around made our experience more fun. I want them to open one of these in Chicago so I can go more regularly!Also, the bib factor made it less pretentious than it could have been here. Very cool joint!

a44FBkGp6kmlh8wSbPSoEA.text: Previously I read a lot of reviews about their service is not good and always rush customer out therefore it keep me awhile to try out this place. Now I have been there for more than 5 times and I can say that this is not right at all!! Almost everytime we got friendly and helpful services. Never got rush out!Knowing that they are always busy and long queue therefore the first time we went there at 12 sharp which when they open their door and was lucky that we didn't waited long. we were the 4th table be seated inside. With a baby and buggy you really didn't want to spend too long in the queue and didn't get a good table. There was once, we went there around 2 yish queue was really long. The bar was full of people. The lady told us the wait will be 45 mins and she took our number. We went to some where in soho to have a drink and we got a call in 20 mins to tell us that there is a table for us! And a good tips here is, if you really don't bother sitting nicely at a table and really crave for a lobster.....go straight to the bar. You can have lobster at the bar too. Do not need to wait for a table!!! We really enjoyed watching the bartender making the cocktail and eating our meal there.Food wise I don't think I need to comment more on this!!! Yummy yummy! Can't have enough of it!!! Service wise, very good! Staff are helpful and friendly. They will come check on you with a patient smile not like check for the seek of checking kind like nandos! Lol One more tips, if you do not know how to remove the one whole piece of claw meat out of the claw, please ask any of the staff!! Because there was once I was trying to crash the claw to get the meat and happen that a lady staff walk pass and she stop me and show me the proper way of removing the meat out which is super easy n fast!! So please ask them to show you!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

2_fO2r5EBx_wFVrNxauYcA.text: Ordered the lobster roll.  Tons of lobster meat and the bread was toasted perfectly.   Good service, good wine.   Good change of pace.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster roll

t52zwCXlc9Wz6ER7_v9P1g.text: Expect to wait up to 3 hours between Thurs and Sunday. Gets busy at around 630pm. To be honest most evenings are busy, at least in the Soho branch.The cocktails, if you are waiting inside, are not the very adventurous, but like most restaurants with cocktails they will be able to make a classic if you request, nicely !I have heard the burgers are good, but I am sure there are other eateries specialising in burgers given the hype over super calorific food in London. I was here for the lobster, and have had consistency in both quality and portions when I have had my B&L lobster! You will be given a bib, give the green light for you and your fellow guests getting as messy and as hands on as you want.The garlic and butter sauce is not the best garlic and butter sauce I have had. but I have seen others pouring the lot over the lobster, which I guess is another experience entirely !Hoping to have more cocktail options on the next visit as the wait can be horrendous.. Having said that, you can put down your name and visit one of the many bars in Soho while you wait for your juicy, succelent lobster!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Bacon popcorn with a mocktail while we wait !

j1llkukHdBYTLe4U3FSb1Q.text: 4 stars because the service at this place is consistently bad (and it's probably to do with how busy it gets, and how understaffed this joint is) - 5 stars for the Burger & Lobster at Knightsbridge!Have you heard of the menu? It's dead simple. £20 a pop for any of the following: burger, lobster roll or lobster. If it's your first time, you can't go wrong with the steamed lobster with garlic butter sauce (comes with a side of fries and salad). Dig in!

tBq9BeRhtYS-9K4yeGbagQ.text: Yum Yum Yum Yum Yum.I bookmarked Burger & Lobster as a place to try based on the reviews and I was not disappointed.  We went for dinner on a Tuesday night.  There was approximately a 45 minute wait, but we opted to eat at the bar which had seating available immediately.  There are only three menu options, lobster, lobster roll or burger.  The BF and I both had the lobster roll.  This was literally the BEST LOBSTER ROLL I have ever had.  It was huge and stuffed with buttery, succulent, moist lobster meat.  And the bread was the perfect balance of slightly buttered, toasted and soft.  It was heavenly.  This lobster roll officially beat out The Lamb's Club on 44th Street and my favorite of all times.The cocktails were also awesome.  I'd give five stars, but the service wasn't all that great given that we were sitting at the bar.  It was a big hard to get a check once we were ready to wrap up.    Perhaps a bit pricey, but totally worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster Roll Amazingness

ek6_HpUJn2t_WqEhsjQEyQ.text: Good services! Fantastic food!I had the lobster roll selection with the truffle chips. They were amazingly delicious. But if you ask if the price is right, I think it's a little too high. It would've been better if they priced them differently. Plus, I wasn't told about the price when waiter introduced the meal to me... But if price isn't a concern to you, you should come!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster this time!

OGO20RYFdkcRjbesmoGaGw.text: Wow, the grilled lobster with truffles fries and truffle salad is just divine!It's true, you have to often wait super-long queues but hey I think it's worth it.On the downside the menu does not offer too many options but surely if you have seen the name of the place that comes as no surprise :-)Definitely recommended.

ibl4NjVvrVRrYxJHjpEoNA.text: Been going to this restaurant in Mayfair from day one  where they opened the first outlet in an ex pub. The 2 items that they served were very good. The lobster if you take the £25 option is so small that you can hardly taste it therefore I always used to have the lobster sandwich and the burger. (£20 each back then)Since then they opened up in other locations in London and to my delight they also introduced large lobsters up to 8lb but these are very expensive although good. The soho branch has a very nice atmosphere nice bar area but it's very very busy in the evening and starting from 6pm you may have to wait up to one hour plus to be seated. The other location in the W hotel has the same menu but lack of any kind of atmosphere. However it's easy to get seated quick. The prices are too high if you err from the normal lobster but the service friendly and fast

a859_CUMSznuSABuIpHLtQ.text: Fab time at Burger and Lobster. The best factor of the experience was the PRICE!You have a choice of A beef Burger of Lobster accompanied with Fries and a Salad for £20. I'd strongly advise going for the lobster again you have to choices to have it boiled or grilled. I'd definitely go with grilled as it offers a smokey taste to the lobster. Obviously it's not the most meaty fish so you pick at what you can.The atmosphere is great, and it's a good experience most of all. The menu is very basic there's a choice of lobster roll. It's not a place of a food snob but definitely a good shout for a group of people wanting to have a good experience with trying their first lobster dish!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

82J5-iRS4xg2Nl8_vv4fYA.text: Nice (but weird :) concept: either you eat a burger, of a lobster. Or a mix.My friends took for 19£ à grilled lobster and the other one a steamed one. It seems that the steamed one is less dry.Salad aside is really good. French fries without interest: not homemade.I took the lobster burger. First surprise: it's with brie so I ask without.I hoped to really have a lobster burger but it's just the 10£ burger with a little lobster on top, so few that you can't taste eat (I est it separately to actually have the taste). Not worth the 9£ on top of the classical burger (that is really good though). Paying 19£ (so same price that the lobster alone) was not worth it.If you go there, either take a classical burger or lobster. Don't mix :)Service not that good (many mistakes were done) and not very quick.Great location.

3FSaqLZXOexd8n68cKjyfQ.text: Had the lobster, I don't even like lobster and it was great!  They crack the arms for you and give you a small picker so everything is very easy.  Comes with side fries and salad.  A bit pricey but it is lobster.  Options to steam or grill the lobster.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. 2nd floor dining area

WhAJAAwPenu4reDyb-ozIg.text: Odd combination but really really good! I had the Lobster Burger (of course) and it was so full of flavor and unlike anything I've had in both categories (burgers and seafood). Very cool vibe with the low lights and quick staff.

CFyiGq11q-p-eh82CqXMkQ.text: Just came from Burger and Lobster in Soho and it was great. Food and booze was spot on, but my favorite thing about the evening was meeting the manager Agata. She was awesome! 25 years old and kicked ass as a manager. Not kicking ass in a bad way, just on the point, accommodating, kind and understanding to her staff. She showed great leadership and I am sure she will be running the company at some point. Impressive for someone her age to be so aware as to how to treat people and make sure all is well. If I was her boss I would make sure I do all I could not to lose her. If you get a chance to make it in, order a burger as they are all great and tell Agata thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Have a drink...or two...or three

Z1su_kksdMymDxYqWQg_lQ.text: Love, love, love this place! Only possible complaint is the fact they dont take reservations, so highly unlikely to be able to get table straight away. For, a sometimes lesser queue try the Lobter & Burger at St Paul. Having to wait sucks, but at least you know once seated the service is crazy fast. Of course, theres only three choice on the menu! £20 whatever choice you make. The lobster roll is to die for! Beautiful combination of cold lobster with garlic butter inside a buttery warm brioche bread... Just too good! Lobster is obviously great too, but it really is the lobster roll which is the highlight (and only possible choice!)

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster Roll

x-JVP6W08xtheLguav2Dfw.text: Burger or lobster. Simple menu what's not to love about it. Came here thinking it was some weird restaurant that serves burgers and lobster.. Located in Soho area in London where at night bars pop up and people come out. The place was packed, maybe after the show? We went to watch a musical and got a bit hungry so decided to yelp a place and this popped up. Ordered the lobster and a lobster roll, both outstanding went pack to the hotel happy! Price was pretty good and a very casual place, good service and delicious food.

kgN1f6YF4liBCbcnonuD0g.text: Very limited menu.  Good food:; limited to lobster and burgers. I enjoyed the lobster roll - served with fries and a small salad. It was tastier than many lobster rolls that I have eaten in the Northeast (US).  The servers and restaurant staff were so friendly and welcoming.

2oyc4PcbHaa7PloKWl53UQ.text: If you love burger and if you love lobster, this is the place to go! This is my favourite place to go if I'm munching for burgers. I always go for the lobster roll which is stunningly good. Be prepared for a queue if you come in the weekend!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

NujPfR132-G1RMTiQ4ZhcQ.text: Our friend recommended this place and we enjoyed both their lobster and burger (we liked the lobster more!). Service was good and staff was friendly.

EDqZ5ZKMNMAZGlmrhqIa2Q.text: Surf and turf at its best. Just excellent burger and lobster roll. Definitely a must come back. Not much else to say that it is just so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The lobster roll
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The burger

vyk72JnP5P9qitl6arkU_w.text: A friend recommended this restaurant and to be honest I find it normal not "wow" like he told me . I like that they have only 3 dishes to serve and you will not confused what to pick Anyway the food is good and you should try it but I don't think I'm going to come back unless a friend wanted me to come

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful bar

_RTzxDCJlr_Hl25HqUBACw.text: There are only 3 options to choose from here, it's either a whole lobster (grilled or steamed), a lobster roll, or a burger. I came with 2 other friends so it was an easy choice for us, get one of each to share. Service was great here, the waiter told us we could get everything split in 3s, so they cut the lobster roll and the burger for us, which was great. He was also super friendly and came to check on us every once in a while. We can split checks easily and he even gave us recommendations on what we could do in London. Overall the food was pretty good, probably one of the best we've had in London (we only went to maybe 10-12 restaurants during our stay), but I've had burger & lobster before in New York and I think the New York version was even better. I'd recommend coming here and trying if you've never been. We had a really good experience and a great time here. The only downside was the wait, it was quite long. I think we waited about 30-45 minuted before getting our seats. I'd say put your name down first and go walk around until it's 30 minutes after to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

thXXsr0Q9zBotikDZaxcbw.text: Such a great burger.  The lobster puts the meal over the top.  Loved this place.  Will definitely try it again whenever I get the opportunity.

VkZA_Ob3bMr-j6LiETJTLA.text: Ye port o' pleasure that changed me life!A confession for this cap'n: despite spending many summers out at sea, me be missin' out on ye shellfish as me been cursed with ye bad reaction to 'em! So while the rest of me crew were out enjoyin' ye spoils of ye sea, this sad cosair had nothing to have but fish.A trip to this pub gave me the courage to try one of ye lobsters again! Ye large, fresh lobsters were like a siren's call to me greedy mind, and ye glorious lemon butter sauce a worthy dressing. Pah, danger and allergies! Me be eatin' what I like! (Me crew had 3 doctors to save me)And Alas! Ye soft, sweet flesh of ye lobster slid smoothly down me tongue! Ye lobster roll was heaven to me tastebuds! Large chunks o' lobster cut up in mayonnaise in a toasted brioche. Me likey! An arrrrrr of arrrrrproval for curing me of me illness! Now me be enjoyin' the treasures of the sea all to meself!!!!

EmL7PPrq8dS7wQ69DXJJYQ.text: Food was a 5. Both the lobster burger and lobster roll were delicious. Service was a 2. He didn't check in after the food was delivered. Our server was outwardly hostile.

tS2ySbZKjkggU7qiVhcWjw.text: Burgers and Lobsters! It's like someone read my diary! The service was excellent and the food was magnificent. We liked it so much we ate there twice. I highly recommend the 1.5 pound lobster cause well... it's lobster.  Steamed was the way to go for us. It was such a hit with me and my wife we asked why it wasn't Franchised in US because they would make a killing.

eJK-4-8meYwRFA916T-cmA.text: Visited London for a few days and had to come here 2x! Basically they only have 3 food items on their menu, Lobster, Burger and Lobster Roll. It's surprising that this restaurant is so busy and only serves those 3 dishes is somewhat amusing. On our first visit, we had to wait an hour for a table. Good thing they have a cozy waiting area where you can have some drinks. On our second visit, we had to wait two hours for a table. The waiting time here is absolutely crazy but it makes up for the quality of food that they serve. On both visits, we had Lobster and Burger. The combination of these two dishes was heavenly. Lobster was very juicy. The garlic lemon butter sauce was the cherry on top. The fries were also superb. On my first visit, service was so so... Oh and I have to remind everyone that you have to check your bill before paying since this place is always so packed, there is a big chance you might get the other tables check, which was the case for us. We were so contented and happy with our dinner that we failed to check the bill. We ended up paying £140 for 2 lobster and 1 burger dish, which should've been just £60. Oh well, charge it to experience.On our second visit, service was way better. The server was more attentive and made sure that the food will be brought out right away since we were so famished after two hours of waiting. I will definitely come back to Lobster and Burger when I visit London again.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Burger... Great match with the lobster entree.
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster with lemon garlic butter sauce

2Lb44rNiSnnOsIgLo0LCsA.text: Like most of Soho, Burger & Lobster was packed with large groups of tourists on a Thursday night. A friend and I arrived around 8pm, and had to wait 30 minutes for a table. Luckily, they took her number so we were able to go elsewhere for a glass of wine while we waited, which didn't put me off the long-ish wait. When we got our call, we hurried on over and were quickly seated. Now, if you haven't been before there are three things on the menu: 1. Burger2. Lobster3. Lobster RollAll the dishes are the same price and neither of us could make a decision between the lobster or lobster roll, so we each ordered one and went halvsies so we could try both. On one hand that was a good decision, and the other... not so much. The pro is that both meals were delicious (the lobster roll was overflowing with lobster and packed into a buttery roll; the lobster was cooked perfectly and the meat was tasty), but the con is that, when split in half, neither felt filling enough and we both left just a little bit hungry. Not ideal when a main is £20, but now we know. I'll definitely be back, and next time I'll be ordering the lobster... or maybe the lobster roll... Hmm...

m2tPq1bdpHD12xvvBODxhg.text: Hey, hey, looks who's about two years behind everyone else? Well, what can I say, I'm skeptical. Why? Because I've never believed that you're going to get your money's worth in a place like this. How could they make a profit selling a decent sized lobster for £20? Well, it's a question I solved last night. We waited an hour and a half to get a table here. It's such a tourist place, literally heaving with Japanese teenagers! It's basically the 2015 version of a Hard Rock Cafe. Complete with staff singing the American Happy Birthday song a total of 4 times when we were there. And the food came out FAST. Well, when you only serve 3 things, they are obviously constantly being cooked. It's very much a production line affair. We had decided to go for a lobster and a lobster roll and share and I'm really torn as to what I preferred as I wasn't satisfied with sharing. They just aren't enough on a half basis to satisfy you. The lobster roll was buttery and delicious, stuffed with lobster meat and once I had half, I desperately wanted the other half. The lobster had good chunks of meat to be dipped in buttery sauce, but was a bit fiddly and I wanted to be eating the other half as well. The fries were fine, maybe could be kicked up a notch with some parmesan cheese or truffle oil. All in all, I was pleased enough with the meal and the cocktail I picked. I wouldn't come back to this location, it's just too touristy and not an enjoyable meal experience for me.

XqD3ZjY2CFXhOnMqWJ9cig.text: After eating a lot of pretty mediocre London food, it was nice to find a place where you could get a solid meal.  I had the burger and lobster as per their restaurant name and also a shake.  They were all great and with the weak pound the price wasn't half bad.

ksbQvs46yhHsLdbGrvyQmQ.text: Simple menu choices - burger or lobster ( steamed, grilled or cold meat in a brioche roll) make the waitresses' hon and diners' choice uncomplicated. Reasonable value - mains are £20.00 but the loud 'background' music and desserts were a letdown. (When asked our (very) pleasant waitress had the volume turned down but why so loud we had to ask?) Nice cocktail list and wine choices but desserts need some work! £4.95 for a cup of clumsily put- together desserts was disappointing after a half lobster, salad, lemon garlic dressing and fries. As dessert is the best part of a meal so an Eton mess with some hastily added shop-bought meringue nests took the shine off the lunchtime experience for these two diners.

jgv8mqytdMI2Vx49Po7ePg.text: The food menu was pretty simple, just burgers and lobsters, as the name of the place states. Cocktail was done right. Ambience was great, despite it being a little noisy. The noisiness actually works for the place. The food was great. Lobster was grilled just right and the burger was one of the best in London, bar none. Totally recommend this place.

EQM_kX7Ft6wncF9RQsYaAw.text: Before coming to London, everyone recommended Burger and Lobster as a "must try"... so I wasn't surprised that they don't take reservations and around lunch time on a weekday, there is 30-45min wait.. at least they'll take your number and call you so you don't have to stand there the whole time.At the bar, they only have three draft beers... one was a bitter that the bartender was reluctant to server me, so I went with the Asahi... a refreshing and popular choice. Speaking of which, they've got a pretty awesome cocktail menu as well...The menu is quite simple. Burger, Lobster roll, or whole lobster.. everything is 20 pounds. Since we're from the US and have great burgers everywhere, we decide to forgo the burger and stick to the lobster dishes. The lobster roll comes with chunks of lobster meat mixed with Japanese mayo inside of a buttered and toasted brioche bun. The whole lobster comes two different ways: grilled (with a smoky flavor, but the drier choice) or steamed.. they give you some tools, so if you don't mind the manual labor.. this is probably my preferred option.Both come with a small cup of garlic butter, french fries, and a side salad. The garlic butter went well with the whole lobster... not so much with the roll... I dipped my fries in it... then tried to not think about the fat as I ate the salad...Overall, a great meal.. but 60 pounds (~$100) for lunch?? ouch!

k47nRoorsY-expR5sjyMbQ.text: This place really should be called Burger OR Lobster...I thought it was outrageous they did not include lobster on the burger; hence the name burger and lobster.   The menu is simple - burger, lobster or lobster roll at 20 GBP, add a beer and I think they include a service charge because I paid 27.50 GBP.   I opted for the burger and it was a thick, meaty burger but not very juicy and I ordered it medium rare.  The bun was on the dryer side but still a great burger!   If it was 10.00 GBP I would have given this 5 stars all day long, but between Byron Burger, Honest Burger and even your average pub burger, this is not a 20.00 GBP burger unless they throw a goddamn lobster claw or tail on top of the burger it's a ripoff!

N5HOQDJgL1XVV6fVHWiv2Q.text: First lobster. Well worth it. Would visit again. And again.They do burger, and lobster, and chips, and some salad and some sauces. That's it. There is a bar inside too, at the entrance, to accommodate those maybe waiting for the rest of their party to arrive.Also, as at writing this review, they have a very cool website.Went on a Wednesday night, after work hours. They didn't allow advance bookings. There was a queue outside, of about thirty minutes.

ARFOBOdVEryQaih5MVtPVg.text: Got here about 5:15pm and we were immediately seated. The order was simple "What do you want, burger or lobster?" naturally we went for the lobster why else would you come here? The drinks menu is a bit more lengthy and they seemed to have a decent choice. I went for the traditional lemonade with still water. We were sat near the lobster room (refrigerated room with tanks full of lobsters). I saw some kids being let into it and naturally l said "Me too!!"  So the waitress tried to settle me and take my order while she said I'll take you once we've taken your orders. Ok i said, we ordered and then were promptly shown in to the lobster room! She said do you want to hold one I was like YES!! its the first time I held a live lobster even though it had its pincers clamps I was bricking it!I went to wash my hands and even before I returned to the table our orders had appeared!Lobsters were quite substantial they come with a gorgeous salad, chips and a pot of garlic butter.I was left feeling slightly peckish still would be nice to have a choice of additional sides.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Come here my lovely!

_XNKy0nQKOaVq1I6S-tHxQ.text: Excellent food! Great deal too! Well worth booking a group table, we went as a group of 8, there was a huge Que outside but as I had booked we went straight in! Atmosphere was good perhaps a little loud. Would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The deal which we had! Well worth it!

7P74lXiEXgo_oQYEOXvt-g.text: Was taken here with a friend because he kept banging on about it after a work trip.I wasn't disappointed, it was incredibly busy and we went at about 2 on a Friday afternoon.The menu was explained to us, pretty simple to grasp, and we quickly decided to go for the obvious choice of the grilled lobster with garlic butter.For 20 each, you can imagine the lobster aren't all that big. But that does not at all mean that they weren't full of meat! Completely satisfied and would return in a heart beat.The drinks menu is also pretty extensive and fairly reasonably priced £8/£9 for a cocktail.

u0O_735n0n-e0K7Nnw3oRQ.text: I have been here a couple of times. The food is good and easy to choose, as there are only three choices all at the same price: Lobster, Lobster roll and a burger. I only tried the Lobster and the Lobster roll so far, and these have always been spot on. The staff is always super friendly and helpful. The only downside is the waiting time, so get in line, let them write down your name and go somewhere else for a drink in order not to spend three hours waiting outside!

AiAa-JVnAcpm29OsPSDXBg.text: Worth the wait no matter how long the line is! You would think you had to travel to the states to have the best burger and lobster roll. Think again because you can have them in London right here! The best most flavorful and juicy burger accompanied by the crispy on the outside and a little soft in the inside fries (a much cleaner version of the McDonald fries) you will ever have! Trust me I have had my fare share of burgers in a lot of different places all over, burger and lobster is hands down my favorite! (The patty is quite big so if you aren't a fan of a huge patty and prefer thin and crispy ones this burger might not be your favorite but it will still be delicious!).Now for the oh so simple oh so amazingly beautiful lobster roll. I don't think there are words to describe what happens to my taste buds when I have a bite of this deliciously sinful brioche-y filled to the brim with decedent lobster goodness. This is a must try when in London and I suggest you order both and share. I can never just choose one because they are both that good!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The delicious lobster roll
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Epic deliciousness!

NL2AndkSo6lCEKdK_7JTKg.text: Well worth your time to try. The lobster steamed was very good, meaty and delicious. The best I have had in London, as I lived there for a few years.Well worth the 20 quid.I would go back but I am giving one star less for the service received at the bar. If you have a choice get a table. If you are at the bar you are not attended to on the same level as table service.A lot of very "strong" conversations happen especially next to the service bar, where all staff talk about their personal issues, hang overs, problems with guests at their table. I realize this is life and it happens, but maybe they should not seat people so close to that area as it can make the dining experience unpleasant, and also you can even hear the bartender talk about you as well.

ZIN66ODNtNTBiax6r2ycWw.text: Could this be the best lobster in London? It definitely will be on the shortlist. Perfectly grilled lobster, and you can tell that the lobster is really fresh by the texture and sweetness of the meat.Its amazingly good value for money, at £20 for a whole lobster, fries, and salad. If you go to Billingsgate, you're looking to pay at least £12 for the same size lobster, and then there's all the hassle of going early in the morning and the mess in the kitchen you'll be creating!Not quite sure why there's a burger option for £20  seems a bit steep, and it didn't look that nice to be honest. For £20, I would expect the best burger ever  but it seems unlikely at this lobster specialist.Review by The London Insider.

wt7O0gR7BAnNaFBAkS5vbA.text: A bit late to the B&L party, especially now there are 3 branches, but whatever. You have to be a virgin some time in your life. However, rather than being a trendsetter like past yelpers when this joint opened, now we find ourselves dining at B&L surrounded by crowds of CrustAsians snapping their dinners with phablets. This place has definitely appeared on the 'Chinese students in London' to-do-list.Okay, down to the food...the past reviews are spot on, this is a great place and when it boils down to it, it's great value too - as long as (a) you don't get the burger, and (b) you're comparing to London lobster prices not those of Maine, Canada or wherever.We went with a steamed lobster on one plate and a lobster roll on another. The steamed lobster was enjoyable but not that special, it tasted more like a grilled one than freshly steamed. I suspect it was steamed and then left lying around a bit too long before it got to our plate. In contrast, our neighbors bought one of the giant market price lobsters to share and golly did that look good. You could spot the steamed freshness in the shine of the meat. The slightly disappointing lobster may be one thing, but the lobster roll is epic. I've had both the cheapest and the priciest of lobster rolls in the lobster-mad city of Boston, but B&L in London does them better! The buttered bread is what kills it. What an awesome roll it is!Now here's a game for next time you visit B&L - spot the person who got the burger. Who buys a 20 quid burger?

fOTmKBPDEHWQ871BQPK1fQ.text: We waited about 40ish minutes,  the wait was not too bad considering that you can see things around the area. The roll and the lobster has approximately the same volume of meat. The bun is perfectly toasted! However, the actual fries were mehhh. I didn't try the burger, but the lobster was worth getting.

f2CpFC_r5uuvVbh_l8DWvA.text: Wow.  So glad I went here!  Was by myself so I just seated myself at the bar.  Server took my order quickly, food came out within 5 minutes!  Delicious lobster roll, excellent fries, good but small salad.  Only complaint was the lobster was not evenly warm.  Some was warm and some was cold.Definitely coming here again next time in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster roll.

3W-hMAbK3-0i_63mWkl8iQ.text: My first time. Eating Lobster. Wow it was so good.At Burger & Lobster there are a few things to point out:1. You can only book (depending on which location you visit) when there is about 6 of you. Luckily for us, over bank holiday weekend there was. If you're planning a romantic meal there, unless you arrive early/at a time when noone else is there, you've got to queue, according to the website - sorry not sorry. 2. There is a limited menu and it is all £20. Order either a lobster, (steamed and/or grilled), a Lobster Roll or a Burger (hence the name right). That's the beauty of it, no fuss, pick one, yum yum.3. Each dish comes with salad and fries. Drinks are reasonably (London) priced, however they add a service charge. Our lunch cost £28 each.4. Pick lobster, you can eat burgers at some many other restaurant. Lobster is the one. The meat was really juicy and tasty, not particularly fishy as you might expect, and was so good dipped in the lemony, buttery sauce they serve it with!5. You get to manhandle it with the claw breakers, poke out little extra yummy bits with the prodder thing you get and finally, wear a bib! Seriously, what's not to love!

lbkSUY9xMaDaFHR0vVcMVw.text: Overall - 3*Food - 3*Venue - 3*Service - 3*Value - 3.5*The menu at B&L is no surprise, lobster in various ways and beef burger for those not into crustaceans. The venue resembles an American diner, and is good for groups. Service is mixed. The front-of-house was rather unfriendly and unhelpful, but the waiting staff made up for it.The lobster is either steamed or grilled, and served split with shell intact or in a brioche bun with sides of fries and salad. The lobster tends to be slightly overdone and on the dry side. They used to offer unlimited fries and salad but not anymore. However, it is still pretty good value for money overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

KJgraNqsVChdc8FgdAua_A.text: Good burger, good lobsters, good price for burger and lobster. Not a bad place to stop in for a meal solo or with a group. If you're travelling solo, sit at the bar. Service was good, food came fairly quick. I had the burger and lobster and it was decent but next time I'll try their whole lobsters on its own as I hear that's good.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Burger and Lobster (19)

twr_nqzHqg4I8UDVMvuKxg.text: Everyone hypes this place up as the spot to hit up for a tasty lobster or burger meal!  We tried coming here at around 9pm and the host told us it'd be a 1 hour wait.  We decided to just come back the following afternoon and scored a table within 20 minutes (much better than an hour).  I knocked back a cold one at the bar while we waited.Coming from the states, burger joints are plentiful so we went ahead and chose their lobster instead.  They have a solid price of £20 for every item, regardless of whether it is a burger, a grilled lobster or a lobster roll.  Makes splitting the check much easier!  The lobster can be served in three different ways.  You have a choice of having it steamed, grilled or served in a roll.  Since it was three of us, we tried all three ways!The grilled lobster was cooked a little too much so it was a tad bit dry and lost most of the juices.  The roll was pretty tasty as the meat was practically steamed and they gave a generous amount.  If you really want to retain the freshness of any lobster, eat it steamed.  This way, you can enjoy it fully by cracking the shells yourself and putting in some extra elbow grease to get that heavenly goodness into your mouth.  Makes the entire eating experience much more fulfilling!Each dish comes with a small salad and chips (fries) so you'll have a decent amount of calories to keep you going until your next meal (unless you're like me and will end up ordering two dishes of lobsters).  At £20 a lobster, the price is quite reasonable for London.  Come early so you don't have to queue up for too long!

kq5eRCwkWVrAbES0RXGPAQ.text: So you get three menu choices here: 10pound beef burger, steamed or grilled lobster or lobster roll. That's it, but that is more than a enough, believe me. The menu at the table is a drinks menu. The three choices I mentioned above, all come with fries and salad.There's no reservations here, or rather just turn up early out your name down and wait an hour. But it's Soho you'll find someplace to waste an hour in. We turned up after our hour and there was plenty of space, but still busy and loud. We ordered beer and El presidente cocktail. The waiter brought our my cocktail  in a manner that which he told us he was El presidente.  Hmph.The lobster was very good, just so very much to eat. I nominated my partner to do all the hard labour of cracking the claws which had pre cuts in it to assist with the cracking. The lobster was cut into two halves each so you've got more than your fair share to somehow eat that all up.The waiter was friendly and prompt always checking in on us for some reason like we were going to implode at the table from lobster meat.They provide a bib and all the utensils required when eating this type of seafood. I tried to see if any tables nearby had ordered the burger or roll but it seems the lobster is the most popular.Either way I would recommend to others but I'm not sure I'm strong enough to go again anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. El Presidente
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster with fries, salad and herb butter sauce

6ckpRJWRjL_6rcXqSvW12w.text: This restaurant was recommended to us by several friends, so during our last night in London - we decided to stop by here for dinner. We went at 8pm on a Sunday - and the line was already out the door to even get on the waitlist. Once we made our way to the hostess, she told us it was about an hour and a half wait. We decided to put our names down, go to Kings Cross to take a picture at Platform 9 3/4 (because I'm a tourist), and back to Burgers and Lobster in 70 minutes. Pretty efficient and good use of our time I would say. Once seated we were told of our 3 options - burger, whole lobster, or lobster roll for £20.00 each. No menu was provided or needed. We both opted for the lobster roll, which comes with fries/small salad, and we asked for butter dressing on the side. The food arrived quickly. The lobster roll tasted great with good chunks of meat. The sides - fries and salad, were also really delicious. Not cheap for a roll but its fresh lobster and really delicious. Would come back to try the full lobster.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

2pMReQlx423oBs5MAP6Hvw.text: don't wanna spend forever looking through a menu? Ding are you a lobster roll fanatic? Dingcoming to burger & lobster was one of the best decision i made during my trip to the UK. although the place was small and there's a long wait. it was totally worth it every bit!!!!ordered:*a cheeseburger which comes with fries-20 pounds honestly i don't think it was the best burger i've had but it definitely was not bad at all. the fries was amazing!! i couldn't stop eating those little suckers!*a lobster roll with the garlic butter sauce which comes with fries-20 pounds-heaven oh heaven in every bite! definitely delicious and they are not stingy on the lobster. so definitely worth every hard earn penny. let's just say it was so good that a friend ordered another one to share with my husband. if you're coming with others its okay to share/split that way you can try a little bit of everything. burger and lobster has only 3 items on their menu. what we didn't order was the lobster which you'll get to wear a cute little bib. they use the same lobster on the lobster roll so i didn't feel like i missed out on much. plus saved me the time of cracking and peeling to eat my food. each item on their food menu is 20 pounds. which in the US equals $40 for each item. my party and i didn't have much expectations but when we found out that it was 20 pounds per item we were like it better be good. surprisingly the four of us enjoyed every bite. for the rest of our UK trip we kept thinking about how good the lobster roll was. tips:*restroom is located all the way in the back. separated by gender.*cash and credit card accepted*3 food items on the menu*serves alcohol *small seating area for waiting. *you can provide your phone number and they will call you when a table is ready.*indoor seating only.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster roll, burger, fries, & garlic sauce
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Drink menu
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Drink menu

_sSAaTyVZR73z2ldTlUQ9w.text: The burger is very juicy , the meat well cooked and the lobster on the top is delicious makes it a unique burger . My husband had the lobster grilled and it was good very well grilled and the garlic and butter make it exceptional.

4V0uWEyJYMf2tiw0O685EQ.text: After many weeks of avoiding this place because of the crazy queue, we decided to come super early in hopes of grabbing a table! Note to everyone... There is no such thing as no wait at this branch. We came at 5pm and had to wait over an hour for our table, but the nice thing is that they take down your number so you can pop on over to a nearby pub for a drink!The restaurant is spacious but has a warm feeling to it. Our server was prompt and attentive. The service was very quick too! Huge plus.We both ordered the steamed lobster. It was amazing. Very sweet and juicy lobster meat. They already cut the lobster in half and crack the claws so very minimal work is required on the customer's end. The garlic butter sauce is also to die for. We were debating asking for another side of the sauce because it was THAT good. Every meal comes with a side of salad and chips which are also very tasty!Very delicious meal, I will definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Cute Christmas decor!

VaTxbv_3F7y1O0iYXoTVzA.text: Londoner's don't put that much effort into naming their restaurants do they?  A few days after Burger & Lobster I find myself at Duck & Waffle which is another combination of two food items plus amperstamp...but I digress.However, unlike Duck & Waffle, where they serve various food items in addition to the namesake, Burger & Lobster serves two things.  I will let you guess what they are.You can choose one or the other, or both.  Variety is the spice of life, so of course I chose both.  You basically get one burger (with options of cheese, bacon, and how well done you want it), a half lobster which can be steamed or grilled (or lobster roll), a side salad, and fries.  It really is not for the faint of heart but I like challenges and managed to actually finish it all.  I think I was the only girl at the table to do so but I don't believe that calories count on vacation so it was okay.  Everything was pretty delicious, but when you're only serving two items at the restaurant, you should be pretty darn good at it right?  Dessert was either this apple crumble or chocolate sundae.  I opted for the latter, and finished the meal a very happy girl.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Burger & lobster combo

kBowJs84AOMCuwl8xGTaXw.text: For me, it was really bad. My friend and I didn't like the lobsters at all. I guess it's because I used to live in Toronto and I had way better lobster in the west and east coasts of Canada constantly...  (My friend also comes from a costal city.)So for us the lobsters were really not fresh, juicy, or rich enough its flavour. It was a big let down judging by its reputation.

5JvS4NrfGJlE6eeE-kwxkA.text: We tried the half grilled half steamed lobster. It was delicious - fresh and tasty. We ordered fries on the side and coleslaw salad I recommend it.The waiters were friendly and helpful.

Hn4o81X30GXSJOPioKYMIw.text: The lobster was well cooked and you can ask for it to be either steamed or grilled. I had the grilled chick lobster which was delicious, but the shell was still on and I wasn't given any utensils to open it, so it was a little difficult to eat.

Xg5ClKgnIupAvU5uGvXXMA.text: Disclaimer: my review is based on the burger.  The reason I'm just reviewing the burger is because of a allergy to lobster that I sadly have to deal with! Burger & Lobster have just three food items that they serve: Lobster, Lobster roll, or Burger.  Each selection is served with fries and salad and costs £20.  Burger & Lobster basically invented the "limited-repertoire" menu which seems to be the cool, hip thing in London now.Was it a good burger?  Yes.  Was it a £20 burger? Probably not... but changing that would ruin the easy to explain pricing system, I guess.Let's face it, £20 is perfectly acceptable for a whole 1 kilo lobster or an overflowing lobster roll.  However, 20 quid for a burger is pricey and means one expects more; maybe some truffle or foie gras? The burger was cooked perfectly, served with crispy bacon and melted cheese.  It had a fresh, thick slice of tomato and gherkins and sat atop a bed of lettuce on a mildly seeded (ugh) bun.  The fries it came with were a generous portion and nicely crisp, but I could've done without the side salad and a few quid back instead.  Even though this was a great burger, I don't want to pay more than £15 for it.  If they hope to compete with Gaucho or Hawksmoor for the upscale burger crowd, then they definitely need to reevaluate things.  Of course, you may not have my crippling disability for eating shellfish, so you'll be just fine with your lobster.Burger & Lobster have basically ended up with an underpriced lobster and an over-priced burger. The restaurant itself is cool, but loud.  Good service and a nice atmosphere means it's not the place for a romantic rendezvous, but a nice place for some drinks with the crew.  I write more about it on beeffanatic.com, so give it a read!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The Lobster roll at Burger&Lobster
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. the Burger at Burger&Lobster

5szkHZmCyuFNMDqAHNio7Q.text: Presentation was great - with a portion of salad, burger and fries on a wooden board aligned. Saw the table opposite us with combos and decided we wouldn't be able to finish it! However the portion of lobster in the lobster burger is quite small, because i expected slightly more for a 25pounds meal (excluding the beer). We were sitting in the corner of the restaurant, and it was so noisy that we hardly spoke a word. Shared a Raspberry mille-feuille for dessert, the flavour was so on point but it was too cold and soggy - clearly wasn't made fresh ):

uguQ9_G3tOfQ2V-xQKnCjg.text: I wasn't expecting this place to be any good as I heard a lot of complaints about it from friends. But it turned out rather well when I took a mate, whom only just arrived from France there as he wanted to try the place out.We both ordered the classic lobster with fries and a beer. To my surprise, the lobster came quickly and it was soft and tender. The opposite to what I was told numerous times by friends. Waiting staff were friendly and welcoming too. Maybe because we came in the afternoon when the restaurant was not at full capacity. Will definitely come back again for another try.

x5LMI8qvHvLafHWcTyB1wg.text: Ordered the lobster roll and a whole lobster. Can't decide, we asked half of it to be steamed and half grilled. It's really delicious!!! I prefer the one steamed because the meat is more tender and moist. Their lobster roll is also good they also have this sauce on the side that makes everything even better. Waited approximately an hour before getting a seat but you walk around and just come back. They serve drinks too while you wait. I would recommend this place to tourists. Each dish costs £20. For more of my food adventures follow me on Instagram - Instagram.com/edubie

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster roll
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

JgVwd4Qz2iMcRq-ZRt_E1Q.text: My husband and I enjoyed this restaurant on our vacation. The best burger I have ever had. The best cocktails!  The lobster was perfectly prepared, grilled.The service was very attentive and friendly.

yAy3OQKD18AwKsaEJRQOHA.text: People alway tell me that B&L is a must try in London! To be honest, it was pretty average for me. I've ordered the combination platter that comes with a burger and a lobster with fries and salad as sides so that I can try both things at once. It cost £32 for the platter. It would be wise to add either cheese or bacon in the burger as its pretty plain. The cheese add in flavors and it's nice to eat it while it's warm as it melts. I've asked for half grill half steam for the lobster and I enjoyed the grilled lobster better as it had more flavor with it. The special sauce goes well with the lobster and I've added more to the steam lobster to give it more taste. Fries were average as well, and kinda soggy. The service is great as the workers there are nice and energetic! Make sure to make reservation to avoid the long line, and be there early as they are very strict on their reservation policy.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Burger & lobster combo

LF4y0nebFBmkyFRszMX_Kg.text: I was very pleased to find my favorite restaurant up the block from where I was performing at Ronnie Scott's Jazz Club.  The food -- great! The service was great as well, but I couldn't help but feel a little silly asking for my lobster roll without mayo (the way I always have it in NYC) and my fries without mayo.  The waitress insisted I have the lobster roll with mayo and wouldn't let me have it any other way, and still insisted we have the mayo at the table for the fries.  It was almost comical.  The price is a bit higher than the one in NYC. But overall, still great!!  I really liked that they have specials that vary your selection options.

dUF_W6dtKGSBPcy4k2K-hA.text: Finally tried the infamous burger & lobster!!They have branch in NY as well, but it's actually not that popular as it is in London. They said you must try B&L while in London!Obviously I ordered the whole lobster. Steamed and then grilled with lemon garlic sauce, plus fries, and salad. Ordered the Hawaiian punch also (refreshing!).I honestly think that the lobster was sub par (boo!). Yes, sorry. It was a bit to dry for my liking and lack the sweet taste of fresh lobster. Probably I should have ordered the steam one only. Oh well....But for £20 in the insanely expensive London? Sure, this is a steal!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Whole lobster, steamed and then grilled with lemon garlic sauce, plus fries and salad

hZGAakI6i3GFnO15nA4lbg.text: Everytime I visit London, I have to drop by.The cost at £20 is very good, especially for London.Top Tip: The queues can be long so be prepared to wait. I usually pop down an hour or two before I am ready to eat to add myself to the waiting list.I have had the lobster roll and the lobster and both are to die for!!! You wont be disappointed!!!!If you love lobster and you are visiting London, you must visit this place!I would avoid the bruger..... at £20, its not worth it!!!!

HaQlXB1CcbM3VXphfTQhxg.text: I always get one of each when I am here and even though I feel like a pig ordering it and eating it, I never regret it! Amazing lobster rolls. I'd like to try the big catch one day!

b3E9NQckAyiaBIEkApvFgw.text: Really great lobster! Perfectly cooked. Chips are good as well. Need to give more sauce with lobster.Service is friendly.  Would recommend it! Fun place to eat with friends.

Voo3hxhRJmJOwtkttMRgng.text: Best lobster roll of my life. Granted i'm only had 2 previously (one in Boston and one in Long Island)  So much lobster, perfect amount of mayo, perfectly toasted brioche bun. So so good. Why doesn't this place have a michelin star??? Definitely worth going out of your way for. Visiting from NYC and my friend from college who lived in Boston previously strongly recommended this place. So worth it. Went at 5:15pm on a Monday night and there was no wait. I was still waiting for my friend to arrive so I put my name down and then waited at a table and looked at the drink menu (of note there is no food menu). A guy came over to have my drink order and after telling him what I like he suggested a ivory gimlet, a drink that was not on the menu, but had champange, mint and vodka. It was delicious. When my friend came at 5:30 we were seated immediately. Service was very good. Food came out very quickly. She had the grilled lobster. Which she enjoyed immensely.of note - I'm a small girl (5'2" 105 lbs) and eat a lot less than most people. I ate the entire lobster roll, some of the salad and no fries and I was very satisfied. If you're larger than me you might feel like it the lobster roll was not enough. For me it was perfect.

V3pkdRZyi7eNY7xvkaXp4g.text: waited for half an hour but it's worthwhile. really happy to have found the right way to enjoy lobster at last. haha

x6RtSoiy5jLcCObUhxquAw.text: What a fabulous place to eat! For starters the staff are so nice. The ambience is very cool as well as the concept. The menu is simple, but great. I went with friends and we tried all 3 items. It's more about the lobster, but the burger was also great. It's kind of like diner meets upscale. And it really works. We also have the cheese cake and brownie Sundae for dessert. Both were great, but I have to say the cheesecake was better. The wait was long, however; you can put your name in and go elsewhere while you wait and they will call you to let you know you are getting close. Finally the prices are reasonable for what you get. This place is a MUST try!

fP2NzNZIZ7o3kRI_BRRdpg.text: It's all in the name... There are no food menus only drink menus.  They have burger, lobster & lobster rolls.We ordered, the burger...it was expensive but delicious! We also ordered a lobster that was 5lbs 7 oz.  AMAZING!!!  We had is prepared grilled on one side and steamed on the other.. We preferred it grilled.My bf describes it as deliciously expensive and a must try!!!

54sb5Mq_k_nOcTnd6D1mVg.text: Lobster roll was definitely the winner for me. Great casual food and fast service.

F_3Aa_Wr4f6zebQmoJV0PQ.text: I'm a fan of Burger & Lobster. Have been to the Soho location twice.  First was a walk-in with two of us at 7:30 on a Friday night, and only had to wait 15 mins so that started the night off well.  My bf and I split the lobster and burger.  We did not have the lobster roll as he said when he'd had it before, it was too mayo-y.  Service was quick and if anything, a little too quick as our food came in about ten minutes. but that's not a real complaint.  Both the burg and lobster was good and splitting those for me is definitely the way to go.  Wouldn't have had enough room in my stomach for wine if I'd had the whole burger to myself!  The fries are basically McDonalds fries, which is good.  The salad was fine.  Had the cheesecake for desert and it was a waste. Came in a little container (like a yogurt almost) and I saw the girl talk it out of a fridge, so might not have been very fresh.  Wouldn't bother with dessert at this place again.Came back with a group of girls, and wanted to make a reso, but they only do them for 6+ people.  There was only 5 of us but I made the reso for 6 and they didn't give us trouble about it.  So that was a plus! As others have said, volume is really high, but it creates a fun, high energy party atmosphere. A great place to have a good meal in a fun environment.

b5KaPw8DSgRXVGO_VVhRyQ.text: Walked in at 10pm on a Friday night to a packed house. We got lucky and found two seats at the bar. It was a great way to chat with the bartenders and watch the action. Ordered medium rare burger and the lobster roll. Both were great. The roll was the best I've had since Boston and the burger was pricey but part of the experience. Enjoyed the experience and would definitely go back.

W9NuYe3pnb9rwObNPyuBeQ.text: Be ready to wait about an hour and a half before you get a table! Now that being said, it's well worth it! Great mix of crowds with mostly locals going there, but there's definitely a reason why nobody minds the over an hour wait on a Tuesday evening, their food is delicious! Only 3 choices on the menu, lobster, burger, or lobster roll, you choose. Once you've place your order, give it 5 minutes and prepare your taste buds for an awesome experience!

yiNvQVIwyx9sqvGhAi5m6Q.text: simple but delicious! one of Must-go-again on my list! They don't have menu for food, £20 for everything, burger or lobster. I am a huge fan of seafood, and i don't think the burger is enough for me. The sauce and chips did surprised me! I usually prefer triple fried chips, but the chips they service is not bad! (Not so Good is, the lobster and chips easily cool down and they taste not so good in just warm temperature :( ) Anyway, I will go there again. Its a great place even you laugh loud or speak loud.

0z7X4ibfii_m9ZE5yBzW-A.text: Loved it - simple concept, executed perfectly. Food was high quality and so was the service we received. Really couldn't fault them. If I were being super picky I'd say the fries could have been better but that's only because they kept them warm under a hot lamp for too long. If you love lobsters this is the place to go.

XdGi_JtNZUZ3DaS_wQgVTQ.text: Went to 2 different locations. Both were excellent. Service is very friendly and attentive. Fries were one of the best in the many countries we've eaten in.  The steamed lobster is juicy and meaty. The burger was also juicy, cooked to perfection.  Some people commented the salad was withered--not so on the 2 occasions we've had it.  Would definitely return!

VsUz5vwvaD68LJNd_bvd-Q.text: Hands down, the best meal I have ever eaten in my entire life. I went to visit my friend who lives in London, and works for Burger and Lobster, and she wanted to show me where she worked, so we had dinner here. First of all, there are 3 meals: A burger, A lobster, and a lobster roll. We decided to get a burger and a lobster and split them. We got a little bit bigger of a lobster at an additional cost, but it was worth it. The best burger of my life with sweet pickles, tomato, cheese, bacon and 2 types of beef. The lobster comes pre-cracked for you, and as someone who eats lobster and lived in Maine for a while, I do take it as an insult when someone else cracks my lobster for me. That was until I had B&L crack my lobster for me. B&L cracked the lobster appropriately so that I did not need to do a whole lot of work when getting the meat out. The cracks were not obvious and did not ruin the presentation of the lobster. You get an option of two butters, a regular melted butter and a creamy garlic. I was able to try both, and even though I like melted butter better, they were both fantastic. Also served with your meal is a side salad, equally as delicious as the rest of the meal. For desert we tried a chocolate mousse with chocolate cornflakes on top, and a caramel grand marnier drizzled mousse with graham cracker crumbs. Incredible.  I highly, highly recommend stopping here for dinner if you are in London. Especially if you are looking for something with a low key atmosphere, and 5 star food. Service was impeccable as well.

M5DWRkC2DYhLLlVyM3N3JA.text: oh man! been here twice now and wanna go back again soon!! first time had the £20 lobster and lobster roll AMAZING!! second time had the £30 Lobster!! oh yeah worth the upgrade so filling and yummy and fresh. they even have a £105 Lobster!! one day am gonna try that!! the lobster roll is so amazing too! never had the burger but might try one day.....NOT!!! go eat here now!'n it's so good!

57CrFTCwqbz3xRlkl9WRvg.text: this has to be the best lobster deal in town - whether steamed, chargrilled or in a brioche bun - pay your £20 and tuck into a 1kg lobster cooked to order. the burgers are excellent too, but it's not a ton of beef they're shifting a week, and we saw lobster flying out of the kitchen in all directions. delicious, good salad, excellent chips, and speedy to boot. get there early for a table.

Qz_1UKeCPt7s4TX9SI13cQ.text: nice with good friendly bar staff

HOHztuAXybGSCQjBpS4pgA.text: nice place for american style dinner! not to pricy food its fresh, big portions. For my self its the best place to have a lobster for 20£. Loved american Pale ale ,cant remember the name.but dont go on friday night its fully booked, you need to wait for a table 2h, better to choose weekly from monday to wednesday best days to go lunch time=]

There were several 4 seaters available ... What a logic. We were rudely treated whenever we approached for an update.

Recommend this place, although is not very romantic,  it is more of an informal place to be. Cocktails are a bit expensive for what they are thought...

REcdRq3jyPMs_oux4Lt8Vg.text: Quite simple really it's exactly what it says on the tin.£20 for a grilled Lobster, what's not to like

fLS54xRUn-DBNS-vMZsgFQ.text: I have to admit, that I haven't yet made it to their original location in Mayfair. But anyway, I was at their newly opened Soho restaurant and enjoyed it very much. Burger & Lobster offers a very basic menu, but what it offers is really quality food. It's not a cheap burger shop, but I find it worth the price. The restaurant looks a bit like any random American diner, nothing special really, but the atmosphere is good, the staff very friendly and it is overall a nice place.I went for the burger option and homemade lemonade. The lemonade tasted amazing, although there were probably more ice cubes in the glass than lemonade. Anyway, I really liked it.The big burger came with a salad and fries on the side. Now, the fries didn't look spectacular. Burger & Lobster does thin McDonald's kind of fries, but it does them perfectly. They were incredibly crispy and very tasty. The burger itself looks good and the patty is just as good as you would expect. The cheese and the bacon and everything is great, just the bun wasn't perfect for me. Perhaps because the bottom slice was slightly too thin, after a few bites it became difficult to avoid a big mess. The bottom slice disintegrated slowly and then couldn't really cope with the big patty and all the rest. Anyway, the simple but delicious and big burger is definitely one of the better burgers you can get in London. The dessert then came in a paper cup. So the first impression wasn't the best, but inside, it looked good and the mousse with nuts tasted very good, so besides the packaging nothing to complain. Altogether, a somewhat expensive but filling and satisfying experience. It's perhaps worth to note, that if you like Burger & Lobster, you might also be interested in it's new neighbour, Honest Burgers Soho. I was surprised, that both new restaurants were so near to each other, but as I like both, I don't mind. I will simply visit both from time to time :)

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

YAXO-Umi575TJekP2kBDew.text: I went there on a Friday evening at 5:30pm and waited for half an hour before being seated (which wasn't too bad at all!). The service was fairly quick, and the menu was extremely simple - you have the choice of a burger, a lobster, or a lobster roll. I got the lobster, which was very juicy and delicious especially with the garlic sauce. The salad was also made fresh. I also ordered the Abfab cocktail, but it had too much ice and was not worth the money. The restaurant had a nice vibe although the music was a bit too loud.While the food was great and I would recommend that people go there at least once, I feel like this place is a bit overrated. It would be a nice place to come with a bigger group of people.

MWxSn90bOXmWI2vRQ9NEFg.text: I did something really stupid whilst here. I got the burger. Now don't get me wrong, the burger is pretty good! But its £20 and not great value compared to a fXXXing lobster!! I was a bit disappointed only because it had been on my bookmarks for so long! But its still good food.

YXy8cFg7-uiFfoaiutoP6g.text: Reasonable price for lobster. But beware they charge a service fee additional to the menu price.Go early or late to avoid the long queue.

dziYypppJTYrbDSxDNQvGA.text: I've come here a few times and have tried all three items on the menu. My favourite is the lobster roll with garlic butter. It's so delicious! This is great for girls I think because the roll or the lobster on its own isn't too light or heavy for a meal. I think the burger isn't anything special for the price. The lobster dishes might not be enough for the average guy. My boyfriend thought it was nice but he walked out still hungry and it's not a cheap place. Despite what he thinks I'd still recommend it!

hKM1l9g2By2GrSOSMzNqiQ.text: As good as the atmosphere may appear and as delightful the staff, the lobster is frozen or they do not know how to cook Lobster for toffee! There is no way that this lobster is fresh on the premises as claimed, it is as tough as rubber (seriously) and chewy like nothing else on the planet! Grilled or steamed, it is tough, the sort of lobster you get only after it has been frozen. You may as well go to Iceland in the high street for £10 and nurture a frozen one for the same effect.  One of the claws on the lobster was as it should be, soft, flaky with excellent flavour, perhaps they mix fresh with frozen? There is a lot of hype with this restaurant but we will not be going back. Wonderful staff and a nice glass of beer though! : )

tryH7zeoOfnT5ksQhv4UjA.text: Two words for this place, simple and hip! Why I say that?  Three choices on the menu and all for £20! ( there is an extra fourth option of a bigger lobster if you want to share! you can even go to the tanks and pick out the one you want). In my opinion I wouldn't go for the burger, it really isn't worth £20, the lobster was OK, giving people baby bibs was a nice touch but the star of the show was the lobster roll! It was so sweet and succulent. A good selection of drinks, it even had my favourite Brooklyn Beer, happy days, but a bit overpriced. By this point you wonder where is the hip? The decor was a nice, having all the light bulbs at different levels was a nice touch. But most important of all was the vibe! this really has a nice chilled out vibe and a great place to chat during dinner. Splitting the check was simply!

_1gGBQQ7hz2e7k3NAFlM9Q.text: I must have been to this place a dozen of times by now.  Somehow, this place has become the quintessential London dining experience for Asian tourists.  All my visiting Asian friends seem to request a meal there and the ones I took there all really liked it. Every time I went there I saw hordes of Asian tourists.  I think there must be a certain attraction to the Asian mindset stemming from lobster being an expensive food item and a £20 bargain in Soho. So I have learnt to bring all my Asian visitors to Burger & Lobster. I even devised a special routine - if you go around 6 pm it's usually a 40 - 60 mins wait but if you go at 7 - 8 pm expect a longer wait of 90 - 120 mins on a typical weekend.  Usually I will put my name and number down and have them call me, then head off to China Town for some snack and bubble tea.  That worked perfectly.  So I was a bit sad when they told me last week that their new policy was that I need to wait at the restaurant and I cannot leave my number and wander off.  Crap!The lobster and lobster roll are decent.  If I am lazy I go for the roll.  The fries are good too.  But I have had better lobster and lobster roll before. Taking in everything though (price, location, service), this is a good deal.  Service is always good and efficient, and definitely above average in London. Every time I go there I still ask myself, why would someone order burger when they pay the same for a lobster? Alas, my Asian side prevails. That burger has to wait for another day.

N_EUxUxk5fmPfEHKWZfhzw.text: I would not recommend this place the staff are rude in flexible and the food is average a very disappointing meal

ALZoIRtLYXk4k8UD_VWZ8A.text: Was very nice food, prompt service, and nice ambience. Recommended!

3rLGhIeRxYcFaBjN-Iil2g.text: Yum!  There are only 3 items on the menu, aside from the extensive drink list.  Burgers, lobster rolls and lobster grilled or boiled.  Burgers were thick, juicy and delicious.  The grilled lobster was perfectly cooked and delicious dipped in the garlic butter.  But, the best thing we ate was the lobster roll.  Definitely the best lobster roll I've ever, ever eaten.  Thinking about it as I write this review is making my mouth water....oh how I wish I was in London right now!

dTOvhLS-cNnYbGghHevLRQ.text: First time I ate here I loved it maybe because I was starving and had a drink already down me, second time I felt that it was just ok. I feel that GBK does a better burger. I have eaten at the one in SOHO and in Knightsbridge but I don't think I will be going to anymore of them. The Lobster is good don't get me wrong,  but there are more restaurants to try in the huge city.

ik1S8ZQycviS-b98bXvIBw.text: We were in last night; this place rocks. They have a door guy who opens the door for you upon entry and exit and their hostesses were very professional and pleasant. We had a short wait of about 15 minutes but the food was definitely worth it. Our waitress suggested the Lobster roll; it was incredible. They also had a really delicious earl grey iced tea with cucumber and watermelon. It was suprirsingly exceptional. The service was a little slow towards the end of our meal but the food more than made up for it. 5 stars for the food, 4 for the service!

qvICvUpo3O5a2PXyU_2gCQ.text: Great food, great atmosphere, and really friendly staff. Burger was delicious but maybe over priced - but still worth it considering the options in Mayfair. I'll be going back for the lobster.

23DLgor6eorLZTB4hjxTsg.text: First night in London.What a fun night  we had at Burger and Lobster. The place was packed but we made reservations. We were seated quickly and the waitress greeted us and took our drink orders  Three of us ordered the lobster while one of us ordered the burger. My lobster was good the garlic sauce  side ended up on my fries and I shared  drawn butter with my dining partners. The place is huge and very noisy. They need to make the waiting area larger or direct people to the bar to keep the doorway clear . This restaurant would work really well in the states

tvJb3qJF0f06BurqfpYqQg.text: On the UK Yelp Top 100 List and on my list of places to try in London!BF and I split the Soho Combo (we were still relatively full from the Fortnum and Mason afternoon tea) for dinner, which came with a burger and lobster. Portions were just enough for 2 sorta hungry, but not really individuals. Plus, we didn't have to choose between burger and lobster. Win-win! We got our lobster grilled and as a result, it was a little dry, but not too bad.Be prepared for a wait for a table!

jFfGDPeJzogUv43YKh44mA.text: Coming from Florida that has amazing local fresh seafood I was a little apprehensive to try the lobster here as I was afraid I would not like it as much as the stuff I get at home. I am happy to say I loved it and I had the best lobster roll sandwich I have ever had here.Came with a group of 4 and all of us loved the food. Wait was about 10 minutes and once seated service was good and quick. Place is a bit pricey but they give you a generous amount of fresh lobster so I thought it was well worth the price. Lobster is placed in a home made bun that was toasted and buttered to perfection. The thing that puts this place over the edge is the garlic butter they use. It is not like the see through flavorless butter you get in the states. This one was creamy and delicious and the perfect thing to add to the sandwich to take it from great to amazing. Fries and salad that come with meal were both great too.The one thing I felt a bit ripped off on was the drink. We ordered the award winning drink they have (don't remember name, something fizzy) and they filled the cup over with huge ice cubes in a tiny glass so even though glass looked full it was about 4 sips at 12 pounds which was just way too much for the size of the drink. We did not order anymore drinks when we saw their ice cube trick they use to give less product to customer.Stick to the food and avoid the cocktails and you will have a great meal!
