d9qPVaBhj5gMKC35IPatFQ.text: Burger & Lobster is an overall good place with a fun twist.Decor & Atmosphere: 4 stars- overall plan but simplistic. Clean. Doesn't really give you an idea of what your in for but I like simple. Having the bar stools at the front is smart, plenty of seating for people waiting and having the menu ready allows you to kill some time before you get seated as it's often busy. Probably getting in the door early is better for a place like this. Service: 5 stars- despite the wait everyone was friendly and we were seated reasonably quick. Our waitress was lovely, very helpful, & friendly. She gave us a great suggestion on cocktails and was on her way. I felt they moved quickly and once your seated your in and out.Food: 4 stars- overall good. I'm a fan of a more upscale traditional lobster tail. But the medium/large char grilled lobster tail was pretty fabulous. The garlic butter on the side is the way to go and shoestring fries you can't go wrong. Overall filling and tasty. I will say 9/10 had lobster opposed to a burger so I think the lobster is the way to go.Their cocktails here are the BOMB! The shared drinks are fun and delicious. The strawberry goblet (can't remember the legit name) was out of this world. Girly but definitely had the right amount of booze. I say treat yourself and go for it. Overall this place is fun, simplistic, good food, and a fresh idea. I can see why it's so popular. Worth trying at least once.

wn0YZtpW5XwwFpTJ29K42w.text: Who would've thought a restaurant with three menu items could draw such big crowds? When my friend suggested we go for lobster in London, I'll admit I was a little hesitant; however, I was put at ease upon seeing the hoards of people when we walked in. I figured if everyone was flocking to Burger & Lobster, it must be great!We had to wait about 30 minutes on a Sunday for dinner but I was able to make my way to the bar and order a bottle of wine for us to sip on while waiting. Eventually we were seated and not given any menus. Why? It's pretty easy for the waiter to explain. You can get lobster (steamed or grilled), a lobster roll, or burger. Each costs 20 pounds. Simple enough!We all went with lobster which also came with fries and a salad. I asked for it grilled but you could also do half steamed and half grilled, if you prefer. Our waiter said it pretty much tastes the same either way. The plates came out pretty quickly and we started to devour. The lobster was meaty and I was definitely filled up when the sides were added to the mix. As I ate and looked around, I was seriously in awe of how something so simple not only exists but thrives. There are other locations throughout the city and we saw one being built not even a five minute walk away. Why stop at Burger & Lobster? I'm thinkin' Ribs & Tacos, Chicken & Lechon, Bratwurst & Steak... Combinations are endless!

dA2CTRRgaJLX3z9scp7igA.text: This review is just about the The Original Burger:"This tastes like an foreign interpretation of a gourmet American burger"Patty 2/5: VERY THICK...too thick! Bun 4/5: Thick firm sesame bun. The sesames did not help the taste of the burgerSize & Structure 2/5: This is not a one bite burger.. strategy is needed to eat this thing.Accents 2/5: Tomatos, pickles, bacon lettuce... everything is thick. It's also served with a nice healthy serving of french fries.Price: $16. Final note: The burger is filling, but felt like it was missing some refinement. It seemed like they simply made a giant burger with reliable ingredients.

f3HD7aE1XPdKe_vj8kDTUg.text: We were on holiday and kept having to have late dinners because, West End theatre shows. Luckily Burger & Lobster stayed open long enough for me to get the famous lobster roll feed. My husband went one up with the full works at £25. Ditching the roll and opting for the lobster itself, a beef burger, chips and sauce. I know it's a franchise but the lobster was succulent and delicious, it was a good meal, great service and good value considering it's London Central AND you're eating lobster. The place is quite big so there is ample seating across two floors so if you have to wait don't be put off, it wont be long. By the way their cocktail and mocktail menu is pretty awesome too!

Tw7KQd11ENYtEECgVrvahg.text: Ah the famous lobster chain.  I have been here a few times.  Yeah, I have to agree with everyone else, they serve the best value and tastiest lobster roll in town.  I don't mind the normal lobster, but why get messy when they have already done all the work for you in a roll.  They use to have a 3 types of things concept.  Burger, Lobster or Lobster roll only for £20 each.  However, things have changed and they are charging £25 now for the lobster roll.  I was a bit disappointed but then the menu have also increased.  I am unsure if it only certain branches but it seems like they have rolled out the new menu everywhere.  Anyway, if you are after lobster roll.  Look no further.

nf3DJRRVaLS-5X5Kgbr_SA.text: Excellent lobster roll, and not overly buttered.  Solid chain restaurant. £20 for the set.  We all agreed, the lobster roll taste much better than the burger.  They have a separate menu of cocktails that they recommend to have with your burger or your lobster roll.  Didn't get to try any, but my friends said they were goodI'd come back for a lobster roll if I was in the area, but I'd rather go to Byron's for a burger.

KV1-9YNfpQ72uM8hP3QIuQ.text: I know it is a chain, but it was really good and a pretty good value as well.  The lobster was perfectly cooked and cracked.  The spinach dip was also solid.  Very polite service.  Also, even though the queue appears long, it is a big space and we only waited about 5 minutes.

AsdsDcOdH-fCEeaWL3kqng.text: It was 1 May, a public holiday on the day we visited, and it was the one of two buger&lobster restaurants operated that day. It was a pub style, full of guests. We also shared a Hawaii cooler, a bigger glass than my face! The drink is alcohol free, like a mixer soft drink with lychee, pineapple and cherry. Service guys are really nice and always smiling and welcome to explain the menu. Even though it was the most expensive meal we had in London, but we really enjoyed it. Anyway, it is fresh  lobster, of course it costs more than lettuce!

rTEgZLI4XFAy6wHCqAdFIg.text: Giant lobster.  Unlimited salad and chips.  Good cocktails.  What more can you ask for?  I took my partner here for his first attempt at lobster and we went away loving it.It would be even better had there a greater variety of sauces available but the lobster itself was juicy and the meat was firm and cooked so well.  Love it!

PyBTSHb1hj58BlD7eAdMoA.text: A fantastic place to come and enjoy seafoods finest cuisine! I have been having lobster since the tender age of 10 and I'm glad I have found somewhere reasonably priced to get my lobster fix. Lobster used to be a treat but because of burger and lobster, I have the luxury of having it whenever I want. I feel like a winner! In this casual eatery you can get either a beef burger or full lobster (shelled or in a roll) for £20! Fantastic idea for the quality of food! You can also have a £30 lobster and lobster by weight. Last time I ate here there were two people sharing and £150 lobster, so it does vary. Your lobster can be steamed or steamed & grilled, in a juicy herbed garlic sauce, and it comes with delicious side of french fries and a leafy salad. The drinks menu is quite varied and the averages £9. Not to bad for a classy meal in central London!As you will devour your food quite quickly and like no one is watching,  you are provided with a plastic bib (like a 3-year old) and a lobster fork, to get to the nitty gritty's! This is a great place to come as a group for a special occasion. Also, a word of advice, put your name down on the list; it gets real busy!

mrnEB_vGkVNqiDqE5KS3DA.text: we ordered burger and lobster (half) for 13 GBP if I remembered correctly. food is delicious including the sauce and we had a plesant dinner.

IVouaZ8JAK4AnonuP6tRkA.text: Let me start off by saying I don't really enjoy lobster. After a visit to Burger & Lobster, I can honestly say this place made me a fan of it. So butterly good, the lobster here made me try and get every morsel out of the shell that I could. Everything at Burger & Lobster costs 20 pounds, so I got the burger and my friend ordered the lobster, which we then shared. You also get a side salad and nice, plump fries. This may have been my best meal in a long while. The burger was cooked perfectly, and while difficult to eat due to its size, tasted great (and what burger isn't overly difficult to eat now?). And you already know about the lobster. It was so good I'd repeat, but that'd be boring. The noise level is extremely high, so be ready to bring your loud voice. I think my friend and I said "what?" every minute or so. Also, top notch toilets here with amazing hand soap and lotion.

AitMDViqVW0TgHsbS3HxMA.text: Love it. For me it is 5 of 5 available. Great staff, atmosphere and food. Lobster. ...I am sure my Lobster had a very happy life ....burger so juicy!

oBvInQlY9iRs_ZjZdW754w.text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!We were a group of 7, and fortunately upon walking in we got to dodge extremely long waiting time because they had an empty table that would seat 7 ( lucky much?) Anyhow, the food was spectacular. We all order the same thing, the Lobster Roll and I must say we were all impressed. Overall, great experience and I would definitely go back again.

fX_LXiO5Q2UGkqptEaDj8w.text: Very late lunchI wanted to give 5 stars but the fact that I had to wait for 28 min for food to be served. I need to consider this fact.You can select from three options. All comes with chips and salad at GBP20:Lobster (grill or steamed)BurgerLobster rollQuality of salad, chips are up to standandard.Burger was chunky. I of course love Shakeshuck one, the best ever, but I must say that burger here was good too. Meat was juicy and chunky so if you are hungry, this will satisfy you. The seafood lover cannot stop poking and digging this lobster. It was grilled but plumpy lobster goes well with garlic butter they provide with. You may need to be patient digging meats in shells but I enjoyed doing it as I don't want to eat meal very quickly. We were there almost three hours to  finish this lobster but nobody asked us to hurry up while people were waiting outside. Nice. (well we wait for 30 min to get in, so I expect people to wait for us too)The chair and table are big enough. The waiters are friendly yet polite. The restaurant was very busy. They told me that this is normal for them so its operation must be very efficient.Conclusion is value for money, ou get good food with modern atomosphere. Overall 4!Personally I like the paints they have on the wall.

JOAfRyTTlA0Sm9BTvV8lFg.text: Make sure you make a reservation, this place is super packed almost all the time. My gf and I had to wait for 45mins before the waitress showed us our table. It's all good though, we had a beer at the drinking area inside the resturant. Basically you get 3 options (there isn't really a menu or anything), lobster roll, a whole lobster or a burger, £20 each. I chose the whole lobster. You can choose to have it grilled or steamed + grilled, I went for the latter. It was very tasty, it comes with a salad and some chips, and this amazing garlic sauce, which fits perfectly well with the grilled lobster. Service was amazing, all staffs are very friendly and fast. Overall experience - perfect!

c3OhnSdVbxcturzbFgpcpg.text: I have eaten here many times visiting London, their lobster roll is one of the tastiest foods I've ever eaten just superb especially if you put melted butter over it. It's not at all cheap but it is very tasty

d_duB7ilE4wdxDTGdJuUZg.text: I genuinely love burger and lobster and think it is such great value for money. The only reason I'm giving 3 stars is because the service at this one is not great. I appreciate it is busy but the staff have always been rude and moody and I have never been a difficult customer. Such a shame as it puts me off visiting the Soho branch

GhNIiKGHYYYBq96NyTqspQ.text: We have tired to get into Burger & Lobster a couple of times and were put off by the idea of a two hour wait so we decided to arrive early (6.30 pm) on a Thursday night. There were lots of couples waiting for tables but they were able to seat a group of four immediately. We had a great evening with yummy food and super service from our waiter who told us all about our lobsters journey from Maine and took us out the back to see the tanks!We will definitely be back, but will give it a while. Lobster and chips is probably right at the very top of the food pyramid!

9PZ5uCp32gbi1VuLGG8tWw.text: Hands down the best lobster roll I had.  The salad that comes with each order is very good too.  Not too much dressing.  This place can get very busy.  You can skip the wait by going straight to the bar.  Great service with good music.

X4WXWNhKlAFFjiXtzvh8tA.text: I had resigned myself to going out for dinner on a Mondaynight - cold in january, poor ad knackered. But I had heard good things about this place, and I had promised my work friends i would go.It has an an alpine lodge/nordic inside - wooden walls and spacious.it was rammed for a Monday nigth in jan! was shocked by that, and I hoped the food was good. We had drinks before being seated ( wine wasnt cheap but weas delicious and ice cold in large clean glasses). The bar was large and the restuarnat itself large.The atmosphere was buzzing and busy and trendy.We were seated at a great table in the middle of the restaurant.Service was friendly and efficient and organised.No menus as its simply steak or lobster.but they have a large drinks meny - the cocktais looked delicious.The food was amazing. You get a whole tray of food for £20 - a big pot of salty hot delicious fries, and a delicious side salad with crouons and cheese on, and then either a whole lobster with garlicy lemon butter to pour all over, or a brioche roll stuffed with shredded lobster, or what I went for (a delicious melting meaty huge cheeseburger with pickles and bacon).Its easily the best burger I've ever eaten since I've lived in London for the last 6 years. The Hawksmoor burger came close but it had a funny bone marrow taste and was a little too muchy. Plus this was bigger.For £20 plus drinks it wasnt cheap but nor extortionate either,a nd the experience was well worth the money. The prices were reflected everywhere int he decor, the staff and the general quality.I am already planning when to go back.Ps. the secret is to go in a big group and book (they take reservations for 6 or more), and the bill is simple to split.

l8xJuZ3Ak5tfaBRSYltYEA.text: My go to place when I was at cordon bleu and had extremely long breaks. You cannot go wrong for £20 grilled lobster with garlic butter sauce, salad and chips and a soft drink. It's a bargain. Lobster grilled to perfection, moist and tender. Also one good thing, when in a large group, they don't rush you out, you can sit there for 2/3 hours and chat away.

gE8v0d6bYT58ErkGG_5z5g.text: Burger and Lobster has a very simple menu, three items and they execute each one perfectly. My personal favorite is the lobster roll, luscious lobster meat and the bread is to die for. Ambiance wise, it's always busy, but in my mind always worth the wait. The service is very friendly and accommodating as well. I enjoyed each time I've went, they consistently meet and exceed expectations from service, to food, and ambiance. £20 for a burger though? Eh.

AauEaz80rl-qWMby-Es6kw.text: Popped in on a Sunday evening after realising the Mayfair original spot wasn't open. Location dependent decision I suppose. Had seen the silly queues outside the Soho branch before but as it was a rainy Sunday we waited 5 mins at the bar before our table was ready. Ended up staying at the bar. Tenders were friendly. Beers were cold.Basically you are knocking yourself if you don't have a lobster as it appears the expensive burgers subsidise the fairly reasonable lobsters costs. We had a burger and ordered a larger lobster off the board for £40. It was excellent, plenty of flesh and not overly grilled. Burger was good, standard fare nowadays, brioche, cheese, bacon etc. The meat wasn't particularly flavoursome but was cooked right. Not enough fries!!Oh and by the looks of the lobster roll i'd swerve that. Teeny weeny. Atmosphere was lively and service good. Doubt i'd queue an hour to get in. Worth a look tho.

dIAM8aHy9YTcNqc6gRbVRQ.text: 4lb lobster, bottomless chips and salad, great lager, wonderful atmosphere, dangly light bulbs, waiters pretending to box each other, what more could you ask for?Great food overall, the lobster isn't the freshest but one of the best you can get in London.

3Iq_ZrbU4PeF0pbKCJTfeQ.text: I am on a mission to rename this place. It should be called Lobster, Lobster & Lobster. I always look at people who just bought a burger for £20 in a lobster restaurant and give them one of my looks that says: seriously?! I think you get the idea. Enjoy the lobster. I prefer a steamed one. Also you can choose a larger that the standard 800g lobster. Apparently the big lobsters taste the same as lobster is one of the few animals that tastes the same even when old. If you buy one of the larger ones you'll also get bottomless fries and salad.Do expect to wait though or come early. Last I went we had to wait for 1.5 hours arriving at 7pm on Tuesday. It was worth the wait!

P0MxYzwTXESLFkxR1rvXeg.text: we tried to make reservations here for a group of 6 about a month back and were told that they were booked for 8 weeks!  we tried our luck on a saturday night but figured it would be ok if we came early.  we got here at 7 and were told it would be a 2-hour wait.  about 45 minutes into our wait (and drinks across at dean st townhouse), we got a call and were told to come back.  we still had a wait of about 40 minutes once we got back but sat at the bar.the food here is great and it's the best deal in town.  all 4 in our group opted to get the lobster roll, and it was delicious.  some pieces of my lobster were tougher than others, but overall, the flavors  made up for it.  you also get fries and a side salad, so it's a well-rounded meal.  if you don't mind waiting, it's a great place for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Yummy!

0AwGjggHXhfe-_--rfg8zQ.text: Came here last week, just a few days after they opened. Overall, really good experience. Went with a friend, and we had a burger...and a lobster. Both were really good. The lobster was great value for £20, but the burger didn't seem quite worth the £20. For both dishes, they came with really good fries, and a mediocre salad. Although only a small side, I was a little disappointed by the salad...feel like it could have been easy to make it much better. We also shared  a tiramisu for dessert, which was really quite disappointing. We mentioned this to the waitress, who promised to pass it along to the chef...hoping they improve that! The cocktails were nice, but didn't feel they quite merited the £9.50 price tag. The decor and ambiance is great, and by coming a bit earlier in the evening, we avoidedruth the long wait and over crowding. The service was also good, and all the staff memebers i dealt with were really friendly and helpful.Overall, great evening!

DModcOH58hkQbHOQiVk6oA.text: "I want to take you to one of my favorite restaurants!" my dear friend said after a martini at Duke's. "It's called Burger & Lobster!". Wait, what? Did I hear you correctly through my martini haze? Just a few blocks outside the ever zoo-like Picadilly area (where we were staying), this place was hoppin'! Usually packed (per my friend) but the wait is usually short. By the time we visited the bar & had our drinks our table was ready.I ordered the grilled lobster (followed what my friend ordered & she insisted grilled) & H opted for the B&L because he can never pass up a burger. The food came out quickly & boy howdy was it ever so good! The salad had crispy veggies with a tangy vinaigrette, the lobster grilled just right, crispy-tender chips & my oh my the drawn herbed butter. H said his burger was top notch, juicy & chock full of flavor. Really enjoyed our meal! The service was spot on, fast & the food delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

L-GebNKtDJG6JEG0pE88SA.text: I went here for dinner..i ordered the B&L combo..lobster was really fresh..the burger was really good too!! Staff were friendly!!CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED!! MUST TRY!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. B&L Combo

JxgSABzlvA0AsYnlDim4MQ.text: Name speaks for itself. Love that the menu is literally burgers or lobsters + drinks.Had the lobster roll and it tasted like what a lobster roll should taste like (at least to me - with buttery sweet bread). No wait, Super filling. Nice place to eat with friends with loud music and fast service. Would I go out of my way to go there again, no. Would I go again? Probably!

gIsdE6RQm5ptiXO8XPKFmQ.text: Food was good but a bit priceyThe wait was short for food to be servedLove the fries

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

M-n05O1VQOo6IUA8Yuc3nA.text: Was on the city, late night. Great drinks and delicious burgers and lobster. Great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

sGPYDLqFxMsPUqT2FkerSQ.text: Great place to hang out with friends or a fun date. Music is good a bit loud but not bothersome.The waiter we had was surprisingly friendly and patent with my friends who may have had a bit to drink....thank you. Definitely a good hangout spot for a group of friends and not too expensive especially with platter dishes.We had a mixture of meats which were all great! Seasoned well.

ZIigic8Gxzz7CMLchUZDng.text: Tasty food. Like the concept. Fun atmosphere. Burgerswill please non lobster eaters. Four stars as it is a bit pricey, but worth it.

aMzYSG6jHo7pxGl7BYJoTw.text: Tasty.  I had the cheeseburger with bacon and it was juicy.  It was obvious that quality ingredients were used.  Some of my party purchased the lobster and they loved it.  The fries were addicting but slightly under seasoned.  The rest of my party indicated that the porn star martinis were delicious, both with a vodka base and a gin base.

qPcwZzdq3tUIRFRxs-Qgsg.text: During my vacation in London I found this place. This place is exactly the name, Burger & Lobster. I am from NYC where we have one but I had never been. The menu has only three choices so you don't have to look for long. A burger, lobster roll, or lobster. I ordered the lobster, it was a small size. When I went in 2016 it was about £20, I'm sure the prices could've changed by now. If you would like something filling go for the burger. Everything was delicious and well worth it nonetheless.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

xOfnjRjNJOiutW-9sJm73Q.text: Food poisoning! The lobster and rolls were fine taste-wise, if a little more expensive than in the US. However, two of our party got food poisoning from the "house butter", evidenced by the fact only they chose to douse their rolls in the sauce and we all got the lobster/lobster rolls. I had thought it smelled a bit strange, but put it off as just unsuited to my taste. The worst part was definitely the food poisoning itself, but a close second was how our server reacted when he came by to collect the check and saw us all freaking out about my dad breaking out in cold sweat, nearly unresponsive, and about to faint. We urgently asked him for cold water and napkins and he just slowly collected and counted the money we left on the bill with no regard for someone obviously unwell. Luckily my dad recovered enough so we could head out and taxi back to the hotel, and he and brother were fine after spending some time in the bathroom. The other aspects of the Soho location were pretty good: we didn't have a wait to be seated, most of the staff was polite if a bit rushed, and the setting was pretty classy. However, the food poisoning and the unprofessionalism shown by the server makes us wary of returning to any of their restaurants. I cannot recommend this place, but if you do, take a whiff of their sauces and food before eating.

94bavGq2lXKl233Rh3MGVA.text: I read in an article that this place has good lobster for a fair price. My fiancé and I decided to share the lobster burger combo. Which was perfect for the two of us! He enjoyed the lobster and I thought the burger was delicious. The fries were yummy! I liked the salad and dressing but it was hard to eat out of the cup they put it in without spilling it everywhere and it could have also had a little bit more dressing on it. Our server was very friendly!I would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Burger and lobster meal - great

6TqhdYE2nt76wWrVEZK3LQ.text: This place was one of our favorites on the list of popular eateries we visited during our trip to London. First, there was no wait and the food lived up to its hype. Despite its highly instagramable profile, the food and the restaurant's ambience wasn't frou frou, but had a simple yet sophisticated crab-shack vibe. We ordered the lobster roll which came with a side salad, chips and the mouth-watering lemon butter sauce. Everything was delicious and everyone in our party unanimously agreed it was the best lobster roll they've had. This place is a must if you're out of town visiting or even a local.

4m7CSZvl3cB1bEd7XHRIfA.text: This is perfect for someone who can never decide (in this case, burger or lobster). I got the combo that gave me both and it was so delicious! The fries are delicious as well and they have a great drink menu. They give you a choice of grilling or steaming the lobster which comes with a delicious butter side to drizzle all over. The waiter was also very attentive and the service was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

xzhH0PYgtSNnPjsCISUy8g.text: Ate here recently. Food is decent but prices are outrages. Paid almost $90 America dollars for two people. Want a good burger, go to five guys...better and more affordable.

Aa7TnLulO8B9buShWVshSg.text: Lobster, yum! Give me more!! :)I have anxiously awaited my visit to this well known establishment as it has affordable and tasty lobsters or if you're so inclined, beef burgers or a bit of both! Apparently the menu has changed from the original, expanding to include different sizes and toppings.On this occasion I went with the original whole lobster and thanks to the waitress' suggestion, I got it half grilled and half steamed. Most dishes come with a side of fries and salad in addition to the creamy butter to dip. My dining companion went with the lobster roll which looked equally divine and we were set! The lobster was juicy, flavourful and cooked perfectly. It was easy to pop out of the shell and enjoy its goodness.We also started with the lobster chowder which I will admit was hard to find chunks of lobster amongst the vegetables. However there was no denying the rich lobster flavour and it easily went down especially when shared.They boast an impressive drink menu as well. A range of specialty and traditional cocktails. The Tokyo Dream ended up a bit too tart for me but actually paired well with the meal. I could eat here once a week and hope this chain expands to other countries. The US could do with less Red Lobster in place of this gem. Not to mention the service was stellar and prompt, considering the busy time.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Top: lobster roll / Bottom: whole lobster

i-d_FnuccBXAiHqh4w03dw.text: Total tourist move, but if you're from out of town (or you've never been) I'd recommend checking out B&L. It gets crowded fast so plan accordingly, the three of us just sat at the bar. Complimentary wifi and friendly staff. The stars of the night were the lobster roll and crisps. I was also partial to the B&L half and half, which comes with a smaller burger and lobster. I got the lobster burger and siracha mayo which were both a little disappointing to me. Most dishes were in the £20-£30ish range. Overall, great food and fun atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster burger
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster roll
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. B&L half and half

ubFjbd3gRWUQUtuG3P8Stw.text: We had dinner here twice on our recent trip to London.Fun restaurant with a great vibe, good solid food. Great concept. Definitely worth a visit.

szSgI4R9J9qMc6f8fd_hNw.text: This place was alright. Nothing impressive. Was in London on vacation, a friend suggested the place,  and I decided to go because it's well reviewed. Restaurant was nice. It was packed. Service was good. As for the food,  it LOOKED good. But unfortunately, the food doesn't taste as good as it looked. The lobster and burger was average at best. Definetly wasn't what i expected from my friend's and yelp's reviews. Red Lobster in America has better lobsters and In-n-out has better burgers. But hey, you get what you paid for right? Restaurant isn't expensive. The feel of the restaurant and quality of the food can be best described as "fast casual" along the lines of Panera Bread or Corner Bakery in America. Better feel/food then most typical fast food restaurants but not as good as actual sit down restaurants.

Aj23a8b4-xUYvEUyNjZk4g.text: Probably the best lobster you can find in London.I came to Burger & Lobster after it was recommended to me by a coworker. I arrived around 7pm on a Friday night and it was packed. They were able to seat me immediately at the bar so I jumped at the chance. I was greeted by the bartender and promptly given a menu. After a quick look I realized I couldn't pick between a burger or lobster so I decided I just needed to have both. Ordered the combo with a medium burger with cheese and a half steamed, half grilled lobster. Literally 4 minutes later the plate was in front of me. The burger had a decent sized patty and plenty of toppings. The lobster had a smell to it but not bad. It was a beautiful bright red color with much of the meat exposed. I dipped a small bit in the buttery sauce provided. The flavor was wonderful and I quickly devoured the rest of the lobster. The only negatives were that fries that came out were cold and if I would have been with a larger group the wait would have easily been over an hour. In total I was maybe in the restaurant for 30 minutes. Service was quick and thorough. I would recommend people try Burger & Lobster. Manage your expectations though.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Combo

XrCAeaUKCvuHq1_bt26NXQ.text: The most delicious meal I had in London so far. its kinda delicious and fresh. And nice waiter. Enjoyable experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

4kd8LjinJSPaOonexSakEw.text: Seriously delicious lobster. That's pretty much all you need to know. Came here on a rainy Tuesday evening, hoping against all odds that the wait would be reasonably short for a table for two. We were told an hour to an hour and a half. Fair enough. We went to a pub down the street. 30 minutes later, my mobile rang and our table was nearly ready. Not bad; but I wish they had given us a more realistic time frame from the start!My dining companion had never tasted lobster before in his life so decided to play it safe with the lobster roll (lest he not be able to crack open the lobster). I opted for the lobster. Both options were absolutely worth the 20 quid tag. The lobster was steamed to perfection, juicy and succulent. I tried my best to get out every piece of meat. The lobster roll was also quite tasty, served on a toasty and buttery bun with lots of meat. All in all, I enjoyed my experience at B&L. I think next time I'll try to go in a group of 3 to get a bit of everything. Although I think the lobster is most def the better deal, I'm curious about this £20 burger!

Rpq5GSn1nw5AnP47BVTyuA.text: Came here in summer and was put off by the hours wait.Today went at 1:30 and had the wait shortened to....40 minutes.3 of us went and 2 ordered 2 lobsters ( grilled and steamed)The third had heard too many screaming lobsters and had a cheeseburger instead.Whatever you order comes with a small salad and some of the best fries outside of Paris. There's also an exceptional garlic sauce that is most moreish.Everything is £20 except a selection of overweight lobsters which weigh from 2 to an obscene 7 pounds, enough to feed an oligarch's ego.  It is similar in style to L'entrecote in Paris which also offers a small menu, mainly steaks and frites.Only gripe is the extraordinarily priced ice tea(£4+ each) with lots of ice but WITHOUT refills, enough to piss off any parent with thirsty knee highs.But I drank wine so what do I care.....

X-h0MJjk36g2FwYdFYUbsQ.text: The gigantic platters of lobster going by makes you want to trip the waiters and steal the food! Great presentation, good-sized lobster, and pretty good value for money.Tip: It's always packed and they don't take bookings for tables under 6 people, but you can give the hostess your number and they'll call you when your table is ready. When I went, the wait was 1.5 hours so we just shopped for Halloween costume accessories and had a wander. Perfect if you're not dying of starvation.I had the lobster grilled with garlic butter (because why would you have un-garlicked butter?? even if I was on a date, I'd ask for garlic because a] I love garlic more than I love people and b] he'd have to get used to it eventually, because it's happening). It comes with a side of chips and salad. Usually I feel like places focus on the main and  the sides play second fiddle. These chips were sooooo tasty! Perfectly crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, salty. The salad was dressed well and the vinaigrette did well to cut the richness of the butter I so lovingly attempted to drown the lobster with.

KHRSXfv9QfT7cU-4DrfbdA.text: I am certain that the not inconsiderable reviews here will have covered the food side of things. It would be remiss for me to not cover another aspect of Burger & Lobster.What we found to be absolutely outstanding was the service here. Our waitress was absolutely brilliant - funny, attentive and helpful. In a restaurant notorious for its busyness, she made our enjoyment there her business.Great job.

Jo7Kmi6gfNxXLrA-8PSu-g.text: The service from one of the waiters gets this up in the star ranking system. Otherwise, it's a lot of hype with little value to the money spent. Environment is laid out very well with the waiting area for drinks only with an occasional dish of popcorn coming your way. They give you a ticket to associate the bill with when in the waiting area so they can transfer the bill when you get seated. Menu is set up to be a selection of one of the three options: Lobster, Lobster Roll or Burger. All come with the same sides, chips and small salad. Lobster and lobster roll are probably the reasons why you come here. Both solid, but not meeting the expectations of the place. Burger is solid as well, but for 20 pounds, it's not worth it.Drinks were interesting as well as they can be hit or miss. Might want to stick with a drink you're familiar with and go with that for the night.Overall a good spot, long wait time with so many people coming through, decent food, hit or miss drinks and a definite try once, but not sure about a return visit.

KZtskrUTjGSdrpI8zGTCUQ.text: Whoever said food in London is gross has never come to Burger & Lobster. I came with my in-laws and husband while on our honeymoon and we were not disappointed. We got the half & half, half burger and half lobster. It was delicious, one of the best lobsters and burgers I've had. High recommend this place.

wffPJkCFJmxSeeeM0rihNA.text: Hospitality from  our server was first class and the food was even better than I imagined.  The wines I tried were delicious and our waiter helped to pick two great choices to pair with two lobster dinners. Thank you so much for an incredible night and I look forward to another visit.

d_SGq6ai2lkyU_bA-0VjlA.text: Oh we waited. A short while since we chose to eat at the bar. It was well worth the wait. 20 GBP for lobster and chips and salad. I don't know how to tell you it was excellent but if you are in the mood for lobster, this is the place to be.  No need for the big boy lobster - i was very full by the end of this. Ambience is fun, happening, loud. Will come back again, if I have a hankering for lobsters and fries/chips.

XLNlUSro9wvlYcUm6jn50A.text: I'm torn in how to rate B&L -- on a New England/American scale or on a London one? It's better than the US chain, Red Lobster, but that's not hard. It's not the best lobster but it's a great value for the price. The burger looked good, but it's clearly a lobster joint. Worth going once to try it out.

KPD1cmBa_eZZ8vp18hJNUA.text: The burgers are delicious, the lobster cooked t perfection and staff are very understanding when a person just cannot quite make a decision. I had a very enjoyable time and would highly recommend it to friends looking for a good meal and a great meal.

7Qms0Bl3Lysd_BFhdTdeug.text: Rarely do you find something that actually tastes good and would go back to in London but this place is def one of them!! I'm not a fan of lobster at all and that's how you know when a restaurant is good is when they make you like something you don't normally like. My friend and I ordered two lobster meals, one steamed and one grilled and both were AMAZINGGGG! The lobster was huge and tasted really fresh! The fries were also BOMBBB and I would say I have pretty high fries standards coming from America haha.So everything about this place is pretty awesome except the LONGGG WAIT. My friend went at 4:30 to stand in line and we ate at 6:30 almost...But I guess if you want something decent to eat in London you have to wait. And it's totally worth it!! Makes me sad that it's only in London but that just means I'll have to visit again!

OQMAdMkKKL9U40aj7A8AYA.text: Love the simple menu: an extremely smart owner & only 3 mains options.Lobsters are AMAZING! steamed with garlic butter - one word: YUM! I can't have enough...the salad tastes amazing with the dressing even for a mostly meat eater.I dont understand why people will opt for the burger! They don't know what their missing...Its always very busy but I've never had to wait long. Don't forget, you need everyone there before you gets  table - which is fair enough.Conclusion: can't get enough of the steamed butter lobster.

tHw4H6wM6NR08PLboy0AYQ.text: If you didn't know, Burger and Lobster do two things. Burger and Lobster. Who would have thought it eh? Well, I've been about 15 times. Firstly, that tells you I rate it.  Secondly it's worth knowing that I have ALWAYS got the Lobster. The whole lobster steamed or grilled is fabulous value for money and on the money in terms of taste. I must say though you're not getting the whole lobster that the Lobster Roll tastes divine and I get that when I cannot be bothered to pick the meat out of shells. I'm not sure why a burger would be £20 or if it is THAT good. Surely not? But you won't be disappointed with any Lobster choice.

micqw9BW1gSMq4Qr73DvEw.text: As the name suggests, the restaurant only serves burger and lobster. I don't know why you would bother with burger if there is lobster, especially they are both for 20 pounds. The lobster is either grilled or steamed with butter sauce. According to my co-worker who has been here a few times, grilled lobster can be a bit on the dry side. So I went for the steamed one which was quite juicy and nice. You have to be ready to get your hands dirty and that is part of the fun of whole meal. It is not the biggest lobster, but with the fries and side salad, you can get filled up.

J-zfbSC82cpPVRBrdbdeEg.text: I'm always a little skeptical about lobster.  It's supposed to be this amazing gourmet food, yet nobody seems to know how to cook it well!  Enter Burger & Lobster... which given that the word Lobster is part of the name, it should know how to do a proper lobster.  And they do!Three is the magic number, folks.  Come to Burger & Lobster in a group of 3 or multiples of three.  There are 3 options: burger (can get this with cheese and bacon), lobster, and lobster roll.  The staff are so well-versed in the art of splitting things three ways, it's quite helpful and accommodating!  I do recommend trying one of everything on your first visit, but I think on subsequent visits, I'd just go with the lobster.  Here are my reasons why: a) the lobster roll is so tiny that it's not worth the £20 pricetag, b) a burger, no matter how delicious (and theirs is pretty good!) is not worth £20, and c) the lobster, grilled, with the garlic lemon butter, is divine.

gjIVA8Ih0L5AaW3-7QOQZw.text: Visited in soho - London and it was amazing. For 30£ we got a whole burger and a half small grilled lobster each, with fries and salad! Fries were well done and as we like them , and both the burger and the lobster were amazing!!!!!!burger is a mix of different meats I believe and it was cooked to perfection leaving a burger yummy and juicy to eat it in seconds. Lobster was a bit small for what I am used to eat but had enough "meat" to eat. The garlic- mayo sauce was so tasty as well... And the best is that for 30£  they include two amazing desserts as a combo - cheesecake with a cream that is made in heaven and apple crumble ice cream! We were really fed in that place and for sure will go again! Toilets were clean as we'll for the people having lunch there. Personnel were very friendly and knowledgable of the menu (not great house I know but still). Did not like that they included the desserts in the bill but it was a mistake that was rectified immediately. Do not like the 12.5% tip that they add on the bill as well? even if it is discretionary they should not do it... People would pay the tip for sure! You have the choice to go up to a 5 kilo lobster for about 300£ so depends on your pocket money the choice is yours ;)

57LA9HNCoWV712u14iXAyQ.text: WOW! It's been a few weeks since I got back from London and I still want to go back to Burger and Lobster! Two menu items...- Lobster (roll, grilled, or steamed)- BurgerI got the grilled Lobster and it was fantastic! The shell was cracked just as needed and they provide the adequate bibs to keep yourself clean. What I was most impressed by was the salad. It was one of the best salads I've had in my life where it was organic greens with a hint of green onions and a small tomato.The only big downside was the drinks. 10 pounds for a drink that was 90% ice and the fries weren't as good as the one in the states. Other than that, it's a must try if you're there for the first time.Very nice ambiance. I'd recommend going earlier in the dinner hour to avoid the 1 hour wait.

39NMs3oQnXSNJEPDCHq5eA.text: This place is such a good idea! So simple,so fast and so tasty!We went mid week so there was only a 10 minute wait where we sat at the bar with a drink. Very good lobster and affordable.

MyNQKEuvTBoxQDeLROEAwQ.text: "This is your last chance. After this, there is no turning back. You take the burger - the story ends, you wake up in your bed and believe whatever you want to believe. You take the lobster - you stay in Wonderland and I show you how deep the rabbit-hole goes."Ok, so the choice isn't quite that simple as Burger and Lobster offer lobster sandwiched in a brioche roll, as well as large sharing lobsters, proudly displayed by weight - Hawksmoor style - on a blackboard at the front of the restaurant. n On top of this, you may request either a steamed or grilled lobster.  However, if I had mentioned this before, I wouldn't have been able to use a Matrix quote in here, so there.  All items - except for the lobster board - are £20 and served with chips and salad, and the lobster is served with a garlic lemon butter sauce.  Oh, the other option is an upgrade to a bigger lobster for £10 which appealed to my utterly ridiculous gastric system, but less so to my rather more meagre wallet.Although the front of house service was distinctly lacking in warmth, our waiter was most helpful and friendly towards us, especially in reassuring some of my fellow diners that the burger is indeed worth it.  Personally, I have quite a few reservations about a £20 burger - is it really going to be 2x a Haché burger, or 3-4x a street food one?  However, Kevin L. reassured me that the burger was excellent and that it was *actually* medium rare, unlike many other burger places.I ordered the grilled lobster and, size-wise, it didn't disappoint in the slightest.  The standard lobsters are about 1 1/2 lbs in weight and are armed with some impressive guns (claws.  Which, upon reflection, is an erroneous allusion as claws are more akin to hands.  Whatever.)  The quality of the lobster itself was great (better than the Big Easy) - I was impressed with the freshness and sweetness of the meat and my only gripe was that the meat in the body of the lobster was a little bit overcooked, which was a shame as the rest of it was perfect.  The sides were great, really good skinny chips and a small token but tasty salad (with parmesan sprinklings!).  The sauce was also tasty, although isn't overloaded with either garlic or lemon.  I love butter, so this was immaterial to me, but I guess that might disappoint some.Whilst I was busy stripping lobster meat out of every last nook and crannie (hey, it needs a proper lobster burial.  Or something.  The legs were a bit of hard work, but highly satisfying), some of my dining partners had a flick through the Burger & Lobster comic on the wall.  Far from being a children's colouring book, viewer discretion is advised, as there was a rather graphic lesbian scene in it which was a little gratuitous.  It also totally explained why it wasn't put up as reading material in the loo.Overall, I was impressed and, whilst it's not the sort of place I'd go regularly, I'd probably make a beeline for this place when my next crustacean craving kicks in.  That said, I don't know if I'm willing to brave a massive queue for the place, especially when there's so much else going on in Soho these days.  And I know that, ultimately, curiosity will get the better of me and I'm going to have to try all the other menu iterms.  Just like Pokemon. But edible.

v3nKYHJ_u4wg0M6wvCy1ZA.text: I enjoyed everything about this place... service was immaculate, very welcoming, helpful and charming. They don't have a menu,so the waiter explains the food individually.. I chose the steamed lobster which comes with fries, sauce and a small, very nice salad... I loved the lobster,it was perfectly cooked, lots of meat and it arrived at my table really quickly... the place is pretty full even at 4pm on a Wednesday, but I totally understand why... great experience for 29.50 including a cocktail and complementary water... I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

yDJf6q1KgnEE6xlACpi9JQ.text: On a Sunday evening I accompanied 2 friends who had both never been to any branch of B&L to the Soho restaurant.  Quite frankly I'm rather bored of Burger & Lobster and dislike being on standby for a table to become available for dinner but 1 of the friends desperately wanted to go to B&L!The place was packed full of diners and people waiting at the bar so we joined the waiting list for a table and were quoted an estimated waiting time of 1 hour.  30 minutes later we were telephoned to be informed that a table would be ready soon and to return to the restaurant straight away.  After a further 15 minutes of waiting at the bar we were finally seated at our table.Since I have always ordered a whole steamed lobster with garlic butter on previous occasions and the only other time I had dined at the Soho branch the lobster was overcooked I decided to order lobster roll.  Nothing is worse than eating overcooked, tough and rubbery lobster!The Japanese Mayo covered chunks of lobster meat came stuffed inside a rich buttery toasted brioche bread.  The lobster roll was a nice change to the standard whole lobster although the bread was over toasted for my liking and I dread to think how many calories I had consumed!The friend who dragged us to B&L ordered whole grilled lobster, this seemed to be overcooked yet again, though my friend was happy enough with it.  The other friend ordered the 3rd option of Burger which is the least tempting of the 3, I would rather cross the road to Honest Burgers for much nicer chunky fries and Burger for just £10.Service was swift and energetic.  I shall not be returning to a B&L anytime soon, I like to be able to book a table without restrictions but will never refuse to accompany any friend who feel they must go.

XqJwqkXWqmOvb3_o0ozj1w.text: The food is good. The service is just ok. Took them a while to get me the menu, to take my order, and to close the tab. Overall I'll go again but maybe earlier in the day. They are not clear with the menu. The beer selection there is very limited to a few basic ones.

SDJ5ZlUYYHx45FO6HFsarQ.text: While, I heard a lot about this restaurant before I actually visited it, so there was no surprise. The restaurant was very noisy and filled with loud music, so perhaps it is not good for the elders (at least not good for my parents). I quite liked the sparking water (only 1 for each person), and we ordered almost the full menu (whole lobster, lobster tail, lobster roll, whole burger). I guess the food were generally all right, but my parents thought the lobsters were not fresh, kinda like dead for a while. So it's not decent enough it you are looking for high quality lobster. But I think it should be a lot fun it you go with some friends.

uqUGxPlyL-MXU8_cr9u7Ng.text: So lets get one thing straight. If you have a spare £20 in your pocket, and presented with the choice between a burger or a lobster, you pick the burger, I'm going to assume you're either allergic to seafood or you just make poor choices in life.Burger and Lobster's premise isn't quite as simple as another similar London restaurant (Steak & Lobster, which as I later found out from the waiter, is a bit of a spin off, and there's bad blood between the two places) as you can get combo meals which for £60 which includes two burgers, two half lobsters, fries and a dessert. So basically, don't go for that unless you're ravenous.Seriously.The restaurant itself is nice - there are well spaced booths in a medium lit, high ceilings room, where the entrance is adorned with multitudes of lobster tanks. You can pick out a larger lobster for a pricey sum, but they did look very good - perhaps one for a future trip!The burger (medium rare) and lobster (grilled) were alright - I wasn't particularly blown away, and the dessert menu had limited options. However, they did make very good cocktails, which kept us happily buzzing through the evening.Grab yourself a booth and a decent evening out with some messy undignified food can be had - it's a good night out.

gyMxmQg-EwiMKFcEt3jEAw.text: I got this place recommended by a local, and the whole experience is summed up in one word - WOW!First, this is a very popular restaurant, so be sure you re not in a hurry. We waited about an hour in the bar before getting seated at our table. The staff is very attentive, friendly and sporty, joking around and interacting with the guests in a very positive way. The menu is non existing, meaning they only have lobster three ways (steamed, grilled and in a roll), and yes they also serve a burger... which honestly is not the best.We ordered all three kinds of lobster and got a burger for free. The food was amazing and fresh, all for a fixed price. I will take more business meetings there for sure!

zRW23JCL3zK_TlUbv7edmQ.text: Ordered the lobster in the form of a roll and WOW was it yummy. Definitely filling as well and I loved the fries. This place can get really cramped but there's a bar so you can get a drink as you wait to be seated. Definitely the choice if you're craving lobsters. I've yet to try their burgers...so I'll have to get back to you on how those are :).

BQxZfpU9yoPda5imQsDcug.text: Hmmm. Burger and Lobster. One of those places that I thought I was going to find #TotesAdorbs but that actually makes ok burgers and ok lobsters that are all just ok. That's not very eloquent, I realize, but what I mean is this: it was just ok. Just average. The brioche bun for the lobster was the only highlight, and I found it pricey for what it was. In conclusion. Just ok.

nc67L1FBbiVkdvQ5SAFpRQ.text: Dozens of adults wearing bibs!  Eating yummy lobster and burgers. Go for the combo!  The bomb!  Everything was delicious.

prdRuw9tEAPNPMTV2LK7Kg.text: Yep. This is my ultimate favorite restaurant. If you haven't tried the lobster roll yet, definitely TRY!!! I'm a HUGE fan. In fact it is my favorite dish over anything else in London!! (Even dreamt of it once! Lol!!) The whole lobster is of course, also perfection. Within the same price range,  this place seriously serves the best affordable lobster. Mmmmmmm.

Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster roll!

pHT0CmQC08HyM6Q7UcEDsA.text: There has been a recent trend in London towards restaurants which specialise in just a few dishes. Burger and Lobster opened their Mayfair branch last December and have bucked the current recession and the received wisdom against opening restaurants in the winter gloom by making so much of a success of it that they've recently opened this Soho branchTheir Mayfair branch was as legendary for its queues (no reservations taken) as its food. This Soho venue is bigger with an area available for reservationsKevin L's departure from London gave us London Yelpers the perfect excuse to pay this new branch a visit - at £20 for any of its food options, sorting the bill out at the end was easy!Unfortunately, we were too late to book a table in the reserved area but I headed down early to put our name on the waiting listSadly, Burger and Lobster made a terrible first impression. When I asked for a table for 10, there was an audible sigh from the lady managing the reservation list!! I was a bit shocked to say the least but not wanting to upset someone who can decide how long you wait, I didn't say anything. However, this is not the way to greet your customers and even if you feel that you don't really care because there are hordes of people wanting to get in, it's un-professionalHappily, I managed to cheer her up eventually and we were seated after about 20 minutes. Along the way to our table, we spotted the large lobster tank with our dinner in it. I didn't see a burger tank anywhere and so can't vouch smiliarly for the freshness of the burger! The lobsters come from Canada, ensuring a year round supplyOnce seated, our server explained the almost self-explanatory menu. £20 gets you a whole steamed or grilled lobster, a lobster roll or a burger. All the dishes are served with chips and salad. A little more money gets you unlimited fries and salad but the £20 fed everyone on our table very satisfactorily. For a restaurant that only serves 3 dishes, it was almost criminal that the lobster roll wasn't available as they had run out of bread!My Chinese Value For Money gene was obviously only ever going to let me order the lobster. While the 2 people on our table who had the burger really enjoyed it, I still can't help feeling that the burger eaters are subsidising the lobster eaters!You do feel spoilt as a whole lobster is delivered to you. A bib with a picture of someone who looks like President Assad of Syria on it ensures that you don't get too messy but hey, that's the fun of eating a whole lobster. They supply claw crackers and picks to help you tease out every last bit of juicy sweet lobster meat but unlike some of my fellow diners, I gave up on the legsThe burger eaters did make happy murmurings and Kevin insisted I take a bite of his burger. It was good but not as good as my lobster£20 for a whole lobster is great value for lobster in Central London. If you avoid ordering any drinks from their extensive drinks menu, walking out having paid £22 for lobster including service charge will feel like a real stealSo, full marks for the food but minus one for the practically polar ice cold greeting and the lack of availablility of fully one third of their menu

Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Ready for action

fH_tt7-UjPdTxCLqr65Cng.text: Everyone kept telling me about this place so when we finally got to the Soho location at 10pm... my girlfriends and I were willing to wait 30 minutes. Good thing they have a bar so you can drink while waiting, because it was really packed and standing wouldn't have been pleasant. When we got seated, ordering was so easy. Lobster burger or lobster roll. All four of us got the lobster roll, because apparently the roll has more lobster. And what a right choice that was... the bread was buttery heaven and lobster chunks was falling out the side. Even the salad was delicious, everything was YUM!One thing I didn't like was that some of the lobster was cold, meaning it was from the fridge which dampened my expectations a bit because the food isn't cheap. But I'm really happy to have finally tried this place and I would definitely come back, but not in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

wYFRT6qwAbpSbj_MjwN0XA.text: I sold my parents on the concept of Burger and Lobster in a heartbeat. So the three of us went here for an early dinner as we had been out wandering around London all day. Now this is only my second venture to a B&L, and the first time I made the mistake of the lobster roll. I had my eye on the lobster prize this time.Then I went for the burger. Maybe I was in the mood for a burger. Maybe I just wanted to know if it was really good. I don't know. My parents both got the lobster, and I was really worried that I would have lobster envy like when I ordered the lobster roll. Luckily, I only had lobster envy in that it took my parents a long time to eat the lobster. While my burger was massive, it was so delicious I managed to scarf it down quickly. Of course I added bacon and cheese, because you want the most for your £20, right? I don't know if the burger itself was worth the full £20, but oh well. And I'd definitely order it again.Maybe someday I'll come back for the lobster. Maybe.

gvxHJ-L8YPCWw_hKsYsh1g.text: A lot of bang for your pound here! The salad and fries are amazing, huge burger, big portions, great service, the place is always packed but you can seat at the bar (first come first serve!) and that's what we did! My girlfriend had the lobster roll, she loves it, with extra butter sauce, I am not a big fan of lobster and I can't eat garlic at all, unfortunately the butter lobster sauce had loads of garlic in it, so I was happy with my burger, not the best burger I've ever had but pretty good tho!

oGtxIQOro99_ep4Hftw_pQ.text: My favorite place for lunch in London when I don't have a lot of time. They don't have a menu, but rather they just have three dishes, an entire lobster, burger and something in between which is lobster roll. I tried all of them many time and my favorite is lobster roll, just because you don't need to get messy eating the entire lobster. Burger is good too, but for that price I think there are better ones (very nearby). Also great cocktails and drinks at a very reasonable price.

LGK1TlwYdxy8WD1y_9zS9Q.text: The world's simplest menu comes to London. You want food? £20, sir! Would you like an overpriced burger, an inexpensive lobster or an equally inexpensive lobster roll? The answer is yes. I would like all of the above. The burger is a pretty standard burger. It's really nothing special. It's not bad but it's not the star of the show here (it feels like blasphemy to talk of a burger like that. Shame on me)You get a decent sized lobster, it's cooked well and the garlic butter just makes it extra beautiful. However, in my opinion, the lobster roll is the main event here and it gets all of the stars. As delicious as lobster is, do you ever get frustrated with trying to pry out all the meat? It's just so tiresome (does this sound like an infomercial yet?). The roll has all of the meat with none of the hassle. And it comes in this gorgeous brioche bun and it's amazing and I wish I had it all the timetl;dr Stop reading this and eat a lobster roll

AKWE5k_x9m2gSUuNp-dBpQ.text: I love simple menus! The burger is good but as mentioned by other reviewers..not sure if it is worth 20! The lobster on the other hand is a decent deal! You can have it prepared either steamed or grilled and all entrees come with chips and salad.We went early to avoid long queues but even at 6pm there was a steady stream of people putting their name on the waiting list. We were told the wait could be 45-1hr but we lucked out and were seated within 10-15 minutes.Cocktails were quite good as well! Cool trendy ambiance and good service.

CvwaOH0Qt6fK_XbfU3s_eA.text: Three weeks ago, we went to Lindon. As first visited, it just provides three dishes: burger, boiled lobster, and grilled lobster. You may need to wait 45 to one hours ( no phone call reservation, but walk in to register in waiting list). But from order to serve only take 10 minutes. 10 branches; excellent food, not too many other ingredients, but the fresh lobster ( I ate grilled one). It definitely worth to wait. They call your mobile phone when seat almost ready, even with international number. Amazing food with material itself and cock in right and simple way.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

3sZDQPa2kZQVzWCOOkIBJw.text: Long queue!! Waited an hour to be seated at the bar. Not that comfy or great for a 3 to be able to talk. No explanation from any of the waiters about the menu concept at the restaurant. Luckily my friends had dined there to be able to explain. £20 for either a burger or a lobster. Overpriced for a burger but not for the Lobster?! Felt rushed in there but the lobster roll with fries was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

-gy2Nx8gFNUQvjHiWA6s6w.text: This place is extremely amazing! For £20, you pick between a burger, lobster roll, or steamed/grilled lobster! They do take reso but if not, the wait is pretty long but VERY worth it. I had ordered the lobster roll and it was lobster heaven. My cousin and sister and had themselves steamed lobsters. Words can't describe how amazing the taste was. Oh and! You must get their garlic butter; it's the best compliment to your meal!If you're going to London, this has to be your first meal stop. I can't wait to go back. It was a wonderful experience and our server was just perfect!

4LevdetjDM6uqvqZuqhQDA.text: Literally he most amazing lobster experience I've had. The lobster was super fresh, sweet, and cooked to perfection. I ordered it grilled to add a bit of smokiness to it and it was delish! The fries reminded me of McDonald's fries which were really tasty and the salad was also good. The lobster roll was chock full of lobster meat and the burger was cooked perfectly and had an abundance of flavor. The device was excellent, casual, and fun. The place was super packed and I can totally understand why!!

BkqreJK0X-DT6ONGHI-PWg.text: Here's the thing: while I think lobster is delicious, I also think it's ridiculously overpriced, so I basically never get it.But I was out and about, and it occurred to me that I hadn't celebrated my new job yet, so I took myself out.  My sister-in-law had mentioned this place so I decided to give it a go.The concept of only selling two things (three dishes: whole lobster, lobster roll, burger) for a flat price makes things really simple.  The lobster itself I got grilled rather than steamed, and it came with salad and chips and some herbed melted butter.  Everything I had was absolutely delicious.I also had a gin fizz off the cocktail menu, which was very well made and I could have stayed all afternoon with several of them, to be honest.Lobster and crab are so fun to eat with all their various implements so I can see this being a really fun place to take a group.  The service was stellar so all in all it was a really nice treat.

4X-3wT-36vfiwEZHep6g8Q.text: The place was packed for dinner, but the wait was only about 30 minutes or so.  Definitely worth the wait.   We each had the 2 lb lobster, it was steamed than grilled.  The grill gave the lobster a wonderful smoky flavor, delicious all by itself.  But of course you drench it in butter.  Service was excellent! Can't wait till I'm back in Dublin to have it again.

l8-nZxeGRveg3P69db8yHA.text: Absolutely amazing food. I've been here a few times (mainly for special occasions because it is on the pricey side) and it has been wonderful every time. The service is great, the food is even better and probably the best burger I've ever had in my life. The only downside can be the wait if you're going at dinner time. Lunch/early dinner shouldn't be a problem though!

o4chgAeBYwjCbmgZrZj_Sw.text: This was my best meal in  London and I've been craving it ever since I visited a few months ago!  If I could give this place a million stars, I would!   I am finally writing my review because they are finally opening a location in the states!!!  They are opening one in the heart of NYC Fall 2014!!!!  I really hope this place doesn't disappoint!  No need to go to London to get my burger + lobster fix!!!This place has a few locations in London,  I went to the Soho location and it gets packed very quickly and the line is long.  They only serve burgers, lobsters or lobster rolls.  I recommend going with a SO or friend/family member and sharing the burger and lobster so you can have the best of both worlds!   The lobster with the sauce was just simply amazing.  So delicious!!!   So worth it.  Even the salad and fries that came with it was superb.  The burger was melt in your mouth full of juicy goodness.  Heaven I tell you.  Give this place a try and it won't disappoint.  I promise.  =)Who ever thought of this concept is pure genius.  I am so so so so excited they're opening in NYC!!!  Woohoo!!! Burger and Lobster here I come!!!!

HMzrvN8yr0ZSfmV50z8eCQ.text: You just can't go wrong with them.Except you cannot book in advance, burger and lobster is always the place to go if you fancy some lobster and delicious chips.And if you want to try the burger it is best to go with friends which you can share half of the lobster and burger. But to be honest burger may not worth that price but surely the lobster does. Definitely one of the place I will recommend if anyone visiting London.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster roll (not worth)
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Standard lobster meal :)

QDnOhoBrAboX8RoluzJSbw.text: An absolutely incredible meal ! burgers and lobsters go hand-in-hand the staff is really great and if you want to be taken care of speak to my man Luca ! Will definitely be back!!

AEn--SqPfdh66Iei4zseGQ.text: "Charlotte, what do you want to eat for your Birthday"LOBSTER!So we went to Burger and Lobster.I had already went to the Farringdon restaurant, and had to say I was less impressed with the Soho branch. We got there at 5:50pm and there was already 20min queue. To be honest though, it was super hot and a nice day. Sadly, it was super hot inside too. Urgh.The man went for the burger - he moaned that £20 was expensive for a burger, but ended up really enjoying it. It was a massive burger.My lobster was good. Lobster is always good. BUT, a bit dry and not properly cut. I had to fight with my shell a bit too much.I would give it a 3.5 - but saved by service. Our waiter was awesome, and it was really hot and busy.Would still go back to the Farringdon one next time though.

UEp3eP7xaUXFZ1ajVlgWQw.text: I had an amazing time at Burger and Lobster. I visited on a weekday afternoon, and there wasn't any queue to get in.I had a grilled lobster with truffles fries and truffle salad. The lobster was amazing - fresh, slightly chewy (cooked to perfection) and the truffle fries/salad are definitely worth getting. The meal costs 25 pounds after the addition of a side and 12.5% service charge.The service provided was excellent. I was given the opportunity to look at and touch one of their bigger (3kg) lobsters, which was a load fun.I would definitely come again and recommend this to my friends.

fnbJnTKi1YjiWUpn7RA0-g.text: Simple menu - well it can't get any simpler then this. However choice being narrowed is not a bad thing if what is available is this good. The £20/60 menu is simple too but £20 gets you more then you need.

2my7R3R2nuOZdKaU5dYe2A.text: Great atmosphere for friends gathering and chilling out. We had the lobsters, which were amazing. Though a bit crowded and noisy. It is definitely a must eat in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

CvegTxcb0OW3m9BrCV0qvA.text: Here is a restaurant that only serves 3 options for main meals which are fairly self-explanatory from the restaurant's name. However, I have tried both their whole lobster and their burger and seen the lobster roll and not been particularly impressed.The burger is filling but very standard as if you could get the same from a barbecue party. The whole lobster was again satisfying but to me does not seem that special; perhaps this is because I come from a Chinese background and we are accustomed to having well cooked lobster anyway. The whole lobster was the right size for one person to eat but with this type of lobster there is not much chunky meat and it does not have much natural flavour; the only thing that gives it flavour in their dish is the sauce that comes with it. I had the garlic sauce which  frankly along with their chips is far too salty. The only commendable aspect of Burger and Lobster that I have found is that their service is good and their cocktails are rather nice and refreshing which is a welcome relief after their salty food. In short, try Burger and Lobster out if you have a craving for lobster and happen to pass by, but beware there is often a queue and the reward is more for the novelty of consuming lobster than for any other reason.

0sGA5XotlElPUghKcd5jmQ.text: So after seeing so many great reviews of this place, we knew it was the place to go. Got a table easily (it got way busier after) There's only 3 meals on menu and are all £20. Burger, Full lobster and lobster in brioche bun, they all come with fries and salad bowl. I went for full lobster as it's my first time having lobster. I didn't know what to expect. Now I have to say I'm not much of seafood person. I eat but I like fillet. I'm terrible when it comes to eating any type of meat that's still on bone/shell. lobster came....... and i did not like it, I did not like the taste and all the effort have to put to eat. I ended up giving it to my friend and I had fries and salad. I understand everyone loves lobster but I guess it's not for me.Now the reason this place gets this stars is not the food but the service. It was terrible, we got charged £8 for service and she did not do anything. She was moody, rude and saw her twice during the time we were there (take order and pay) We were all dissapointed and never coming back here again.

HtKERPcaQ9PUsFDXZcfFPA.text: Loved this place, we managed to get a seat straight away at the bar (over an hour if we wanted a table).Service was really quick and being at the bar meant we were constantly topped up with drinks. The iced tea was fantastic.Neither of us tried the burger or the lobster roll, but went for the steamed lobster instead with the garlic butter sauce. It came on a platter, in all it's glory, bigger than I thought it was going to be with a really tasty side salad and fries. It could have been cracked just a little more but it was fun digging into everything.Too full for dessert we were happy with price, food and service. I'll try to go back again to try the other items. We did see a guy getting a burger protein style, i.e. no bun, it gets served under this huge dome of lettuce, it looked really fun!

1ehwqWVlXdSnXSNNelXEmA.text: It can be challenging to get a really good breakfast in London, so if you are looking for more than just a pastry and coffee, this is the place to go. Wonderful buffet or general menu. Their eggs Benedict was wonderful

9KFpnObR9_ruKq7rvh3eBw.text: This is such a fun place.  There is a bit of a wait so don't come if you are staving. There is no where to wait.  It is packed!  There are only 3 items on the menu so pick a hamburger or lobster - steamed or grilled.  The steamed is more moist so I recommend that.  They are all 20 pounds.  They all come with fries.  The food was good.  The experience was OK, they try to get people in and out.  The servers aren't really chatty.  I would go back.

d7cvtdOWoVFEcbP7eK_pFw.text: HOLY JAMOLY, this place is TO DIE FOR.  For only having 3 items on the menu (burger, lobster roll, or grilled/steamed lobster - £20 for whichever you decide with), you are pretty freaken amazing.  The wait is pretty long, so try to sneak yourself into the bar area, cause that wait is much more bearable if you do so.  There's plenty of waiting seating but I wish they would actually convert it into dining space!!!Lobster was grilled perfectly and absolutely to die for with the garlic lemon butter sauce.  I literally cleaned that lobster goooooodd!!!  The light salad and fries were a nice add to the lobster, and I could not be happier with my meal.  When I visit London again, this is an absolute must for me.  Anyone that's visiting London, you gotta try this place!!!

KcjpE1o6FBsxOCeaTYTvVw.text: I'll be plain. This is the BEST lobster roll you can get outside Maine. Yes, £20 is a fuck ton of money for one sandwich. But it's a really good one.(and it's a hell of a lot less silly than a £20 burger)

dFZq6SmKCukcgVVP058DCw.text: Don't be dissuaded by the long lines of Asians outside (myself included)-- it is not just a tourist trap. They have three entree options, all 20GBP-- burger, lobster roll, or whole lobster. After some consideration and a quick poll of the bar staff, I chose the whole lobster over the roll. You can have your whole lobster grilled or steamed, I chose grilled as did most others in my line of sight. Alongside the lobster, which they've considerately cracked in strategic places ahead of time, you get a creamy sauce, mixed greens, and fries. The meal itself took a short time to come out and was quite good, definitely worth the price. Make sure to come early (around 5-530) if you don't want to wait for more than 15-20 min for dinner. They take reservations for parties of 6 or more.

g2p9C6VDl8fyTVisQBDm2w.text: Burger. Good. Lobster. GOOOOOOOD (Opt for the garlic butter sauce, it's TO DIE FOR!!).So before I ever stepped foot into B&L, I was briefed on the whole experience. First, there's typically a queue with wait times possibly exceeding an hour+. Second, you have three choices: Burger, Lobster, or Lobster Roll. Third, it's 20 pounds no matter which option you pick. Luckily for me, I came with two friends and we all decided to get one of each and share! B&L even accommodated this by cutting each into three pieces! I enjoyed everything thoroughly... the burger is tasty and the lobster is fresh and delicious. The lobster roll is on the smaller side, but was still amazing. The food was so good, I brought another foodie friend to B&L a few days later. You can also choose a bigger lobster for a lot more $$$ and you can see what they have to offer on the board. I'll also end on the fact that the service was fantastic and the cocktails are strong!
